[The miscreant]1783-the miscreant probably had remembered this , and had known that [he]65-harry might escape stealthily without the noise of a rapid retreat . When the work was over , when [he]65-harry had put out the fire [he]65-harry had [himself]65-harry lighted , and had exterminated the lingering remnants of that which had been intended to destroy [him]65-harry , [he]65-harry stood still a while almost in despair . [His]65-harry condition seemed to be hopeless . What could [he]65-harry do against [such a band of enemies]1895-such a band of enemies , knowing as [he]65-harry did that , had [he]65-harry been backed even by [a score of trusty followers]1896-a score of trusty followers , [one foe]1897-one foe might still suffice to ruin [him]65-harry ? At the present moment [he]65-harry was very hot with the work [he]65-harry had done , as were also [Jacko]51-jacko and [the German]60-the german . [O’Dowd]49-mickey had also come up as [they]1898-their were completing [their]1898-their work . [Their]1898-their mode of extinguishing the flames had been to beat [them]1898-their down with branches of gum - tree loaded with leaves . By sweeping these along the burning ground the low flames would be scattered and expelled . But the work was very hard and hot . The boughs [they]1898-their used were heavy , and the air around [them]1898-their , sultry enough from its own properties , was made almost unbearable by the added heat of the fires . The work had been so far done , but it might be begun again at any moment , either near or at a distance . No doubt the attempt would be made elsewhere along [the boundary between [Gangoil]65-harry and [Boolabong]18-boolabong]1899-the boundary between gangoil and boolabong — was very probably being made at this moment . [The two men whom [he]65-harry could trust and [Jacko]51-jacko]1900-the two men whom he could trust and jacko were now with [him]65-harry . [They]1898-their were wiping [their]1898-their brows with [their]1898-their arms and panting with [their]1898-their work . [He]65-harry first resolved on sending [Mickey O’Dowd]49-mickey to [the house]226-the house . The distance was great , and [the man]451-the man ’s assistance might be essential . But [he]65-harry could not bear to leave [[his]65-harry wife]104-his wife without news from [him]65-harry . Then , after considering a while , [he]65-harry made up [his]65-harry mind to go back toward [[his]65-harry own fence]1904-his own fence , making [his]65-harry way as [he]65-harry went southerly down toward [the river]164-the river . [[They]1898-their who were determined to injure [him]65-harry]1906-they who were determined to injure him would , [he]65-harry thought , repeat [their]1898-their attempt in that direction . [He]65-harry hardly said a word to [[his]65-harry two followers]1907-his two followers , but rode at a foot - pace to the spot at [his]65-harry fence which [he]65-harry had selected as [the site of [his]65-harry bivouac]1908-the site of his bivouac for the night . “[0-i] It wo n’t be very cheery , [Bender]59-karl bender , ” [he]65-harry said to [the German]415-the german ; “[59-karl bender] but [we]1164-we shall have to make a night of it till [they]1165-they disturb [us]1164-we again . ” [The German]415-the german made a motion with [his]415-the german arms intended to signify [his]415-the german utter indifference . [One place]1911-one place was the same as another to [him]65-harry . [Jacko]51-jacko uttered [his]51-jacko usual ejaculation , and then , having hitched [his]51-jacko horse to the fence , threw [himself]51-jacko on [his]51-jacko back upon the grass . No doubt [they]1165-they all slept , but [they]1165-they slept as watchers sleep , with one eye open . It was [Harry]65-harry who first saw the light which a few minutes later made itself visible to [the ladies at [the home station]917-the home station]1912-the ladies at the home station . “[59-karl bender] [Karl]59-karl bender , ” [he]65-harry exclaimed , jumping up , “[59-karl bender] [they]1165-they ’re at it again — look there . ” In less than half a minute , and without speaking another word , [they]1165-they were all on [their]1165-they horses and riding in the direction of the light . It came from a part of [the Boolabong]29-the boolabong run somewhat nearer to [the river]164-the river than the place at which [they]1165-they had stationed [themselves]1165-they , where the strip of ground between [Harry]65-harry ’s fence and [the acknowledged boundary of [Brownbie ’s run]819-brownbie ’s run]1915-the acknowledged boundary of brownbie ’s run was the narrowest . As [they]1165-they approached the fire , [they]1165-they became aware that it had been lighted on [Boolabong]18-boolabong . On this occasion [Harry]65-harry did not ride on up to the flames , knowing that the use or loss of a few minutes might save or destroy [[his]65-harry property]1917-his property . [He]65-harry hardly spoke a word as [he]65-harry proceeded on [his]65-harry business , feeling that [they]1165-they upon whom [he]65-harry had to depend were sufficiently instructed , if only [they]1165-they would be sufficiently energetic . “[1165-they] Keep it well under , but let it run , ” was all [he]65-harry said , as , lighting a dried bush with a match , [he]65-harry ran the fire along the ground in front of the coming flames . [A stranger seeing it all]1918-a stranger seeing it all would have felt sure that the remedy would have been as bad as the disease , for the fire which [Harry]65-harry [himself]65-harry made every now and again seemed to get the better of [those who were endeavoring to control it]1919-those who were endeavoring to control it . There might perhaps be a quarter of a mile between the front of the advancing fire and the line at which [Harry]65-harry had commenced to destroy the food which would have fed the coming flames . [He]65-harry [himself]65-harry , as quickly as [he]65-harry lighted the grass , which in itself was the work but of a moment , would strain [himself]65-harry to the utmost at the much harder task of controlling [his]65-harry own fire , so that it should not run away from [him]65-harry , and get , as it were , out of [his]65-harry hands , and be as bad to [him]65-harry as that which [he]65-harry was thus seeking to circumvent . [The German]60-the german and [Jacko]51-jacko worked like [heroes]1920-heroes , probably with intense enjoyment of the excitement , and , after a while , found [a fourth figure among the flames]1921-a fourth figure among the flames , for [Mickey]49-mickey had now returned . “[1166-you] [You]1166-you saw [them]1167-them , ” [Harry]65-harry said , panting with [his]65-harry work . “[1166-you] [They]1167-them ’s all right , ” said [Mickey]49-mickey , flopping away with a great bough ; “[1167-them] but that tarnation [Chinese]90-chinese has gone off . ” “[90-chinese] [My]0-i word ! [Sing Sing]54-sing sing . Find [him]90-chinese at [Boolabong]18-boolabong , ” said [Jacko]51-jacko . [The German , whose gum - tree bough was a very big one]1922-the german , whose gum - tree bough was a very big one , and whose every thought was intent on letting the fire run while [he]1922-the german , whose gum - tree bough was a very big one still held it in hand , had not breath for a syllable . But the back fire was extending itself , so as to get round [them]1167-them . Every now and then [Harry]65-harry extended [his]65-harry own line , moving always forward toward [Gangoil]65-harry as [he]65-harry did so , though [he]65-harry and [[his]65-harry men]726-his men were always on [[Brownbie]43-georgie ’s territory]1924-brownbie ’s territory . [He]65-harry had no doubt but that where [he]65-harry could succeed in destroying the grass for a breadth of forty or fifty yards [he]65-harry would starve out the inimical flames . The trees and bushes without the herbage would not enable it to travel [a yard]1925-a yard . Wherever the grass was burned down black to the soil , the fire would stop . But should [they]1167-them , who were at work , once allow [themselves]1167-them to be outflanked , [their]1167-them exertions would be all in vain . And then those wretches might light a dozen fires . The work was so hard , so hot , and often so hopeless , that [the unhappy young squatter]1926-the unhappy young squatter was more than once tempted to bid [[his]1926-the unhappy young squatter men]726-his men desist and to return to [[his]1926-the unhappy young squatter homestead]1928-his homestead . The flames would not follow [him]1926-the unhappy young squatter [there]290-there . [He]1926-the unhappy young squatter could , at any rate , make that safe . And then , when [he]1926-the unhappy young squatter had repudiated this feeling as unworthy of [him]1926-the unhappy young squatter , [he]1926-the unhappy young squatter began to consider within [himself]1926-the unhappy young squatter whether [he]1926-the unhappy young squatter would not do better for [[his]1926-the unhappy young squatter property]1917-his property by taking [[his]1926-the unhappy young squatter men]726-his men with [him]1926-the unhappy young squatter on to [his]1926-the unhappy young squatter run , and endeavoring to drive [his]1926-the unhappy young squatter sheep out of danger . But as [he]1926-the unhappy young squatter thought of all this , [he]1926-the unhappy young squatter still worked , still fired the grass , and still controlled the flames . Presently [he]1926-the unhappy young squatter became aware of what seemed to [him]1926-the unhappy young squatter at first to be a third fire . Through the trees , in the direction of [the river]164-the river , [he]1926-the unhappy young squatter could see the glimmering of low flames and the figures of [men]130-men . But it was soon apparent to [him]1926-the unhappy young squatter that [these men]802-these men were working in [his]1926-the unhappy young squatter cause , and that [they]802-these men , too , were burning the grass that would have fed the advancing flames . At first [he]1926-the unhappy young squatter could not spare the minute which would be necessary to find out who was [[his]1926-the unhappy young squatter friend]498-his friend , but , as [they]802-these men drew nearer , [he]1926-the unhappy young squatter knew [the man]451-the man . It was [the sugar planter from [the mill]484-the mill]1937-the sugar planter from the mill and with [him]1937-the sugar planter from the mill [[his]1937-the sugar planter from the mill foreman]1939-his foreman . “[1168-we] [We]1168-we ’ve been doing [our]1168-we best , ” said [Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot , “[1168-we] but [we]1168-we ’ve been terribly afraid that the fire would slip away from [us]1168-we . ” “[1168-we] It ’s the only thing , ” said [Harry]65-harry , too much excited at the moment to ask questions as to the cause of [Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot ’s presence so far from [[his]65-harry home]1940-his home at that time of the evening . “[1168-we] It ’s getting round [us]1168-we , [I]0-i ’m afraid , all the same . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know but it is . It ’s almost impossible to distinguish . How hot the fire makes it ! ” “[0-i] Hot , indeed ! ” said [Harry]65-harry . “[0-i] It ’s killing work for [men]130-men , and then all for no good ! To think that [men]130-men , creatures that call [themselves]130-men [men]130-men , should do such a thing as this ! It breaks [one]1423-one ’s heart . ” [He]0-i had paused as [he]0-i spoke , leaning on the great battered bough which [he]0-i held , but in an instant was at work with it again . “[0-i] Do [you]0-i stay here , [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot , with [the men]292-the men , and [I]0-i ’ll go on beyond where [you]0-i began . If [I]0-i find the fire growing down , [I]0-i ’ll shout , and [they]292-the men can come to [me]0-i . ” So saying , [he]0-i rushed on with a lighted bush torch in [his]0-i band . Suddenly [he]0-i found [himself]0-i confronted in the bush by [a man on horseback , whom [he]0-i at once recognized as [Georgie Brownbie]43-georgie]1941-a man on horseback , whom he at once recognized as georgie brownbie . [He]0-i forgot for a moment where [he]0-i was and began to question the reprobate as to [his]0-i presence at that spot . “[292-the men] That ’s like [your]0-i impudence , ” said [Georgie]43-georgie . “[0-i] [You]0-i ’re not only trespassing , but [you]0-i ’re destroying [our]1174-our property willfully , and [you]0-i ask [me]0-i what business [I]0-i have [here]260-here . [You]0-i ’re [a nice sort of young man]1176-a nice sort of young man . ” [Harry]65-harry , checked for a moment by the remembrance that [he]65-harry was in truth upon [Boolabong]18-boolabong run , did not at once answer . “[1176-a nice sort of young man] Put that bush down , and do n’t burn [our]1174-our grass , ” continued [Georgie]43-georgie , “[0-i] or [you]0-i shall have to answer for it . What right have [you]0-i to fire [our]1174-our grass ? ” “[0-i] Who fired it first ? ” “[1177-it] [It]1177-it lighted itself . That ’s no rule why [you]0-i should light it more . [You]0-i give over , or [I]0-i punch [your]0-i head for [you]0-i . ” [[Harry]65-harry ’s men]1942-harry ’s men and [Medlicot]47-medlicot were advancing toward [him]1179-he , trampling out [their]1942-harry ’s men own embers as [they]1942-harry ’s men came ; and [Georgie Brownbie]43-georgie , who was alone , when [he]43-georgie saw that there were [four or five men]1943-four or five men against [him]43-georgie , turned round and rode back . “[0-i] Did [you]1178-you ever see impudence like that ? ” said [Harry]65-harry . “[1179-he] [He]1179-he ’s probably [the very man who set the match]1180-the very man who set the match , and yet [he]1179-he comes and brazens it out with [me]0-i . ” “[1179-he] [I]0-i do n’t think [he]1179-he ’s [the man who set the match]1181-the man who set the match , ” said [Medlicot]47-medlicot , quietly ; “[1179-he] at any rate there was another . ” “[1179-he] Who was it ? ” “[1182-my man] [[My]0-i man]1182-my man , [Nokes]58-nokes . [I]0-i saw [him]1182-my man with the torch in [his]1182-my man hand . ” “[1182-my man] Heaven and earth ! ” “[57-mr. heathcote] Yes , [Mr. Heathcote]57-mr. heathcote . [I]0-i saw [him]1182-my man put it down . [You]57-mr. heathcote were about right , [you]57-mr. heathcote see , and [I]0-i was about wrong . ” [Harry]65-harry had not a word to say , unless it were tell [the man]451-the man that [he]65-harry loved [him]451-the man for the frankness of [his]65-harry confession . But the moment was hardly auspicious for such a declaration . There was no excuse for [them]1183-their to pause in [their]1183-their work , for the fire was still crackling at [their]1183-their back , and [they]1183-their did no more than pause . “[0-i] Ah ! ” said [Harry]65-harry , “[0-i] there it goes ; [we]1183-their shall be done at last . ” For [he]65-harry saw that [he]65-harry was being outflanked by the advancing flames . But still [they]1183-their worked , drawing lines of fire here and there , and still [they]1183-their hoped that there might be ground for hope . [Nokes]58-nokes had been seen ; but , pregnant as the theme might be with words , it was almost impossible to talk . Questions could not be asked and answered without stopping in [their]1183-their toil . There were questions which [Harry]65-harry longed to ask . Could [Medlicot]47-medlicot swear to [the man]451-the man ? Did [the man]451-the man know that [he]451-the man had been seen ? If [he]451-the man knew that [he]451-the man had been watched while [he]451-the man lit the grass , [he]451-the man would soon be far away from [[Medlicot]47-medlicot ’s Mill]11-medlicot ’s mill and [Gangoil]65-harry . [Harry]65-harry felt that it would be a consolation to [him]65-harry in [his]65-harry trouble if [he]65-harry could get hold of [this man]497-this man , and keep [him]497-this man , and prosecute [him]497-this man — and have [him]497-this man hung . Even in the tumult of the moment [he]65-harry was able to reflect about it , and to think that [he]65-harry remembered that the crime of arson was capital in [the colony of [Queensland]5-queensland]1948-the colony of queensland . [He]65-harry had endeavored to be good to [the men with whom [he]65-harry had dealings]1949-the men with whom he had dealings . [He]65-harry had not stinted [their]1949-the men with whom he had dealings food , or cut [them]1949-the men with whom he had dealings short in [their]1949-the men with whom he had dealings wages , or been hard in exacting work from [them]1949-the men with whom he had dealings . And this was [his]65-harry return ! Ideas as to the excellence of absolute dominion and power flitted across [his]65-harry brain — such power as [Abraham]91-abraham , no doubt , exercised . In [Abraham]91-abraham ’s time [the people]1950-the people were submissive , and [the world]1427-the world was happy . [Harry Heathcote]65-harry , at least , had never heard that it was not happy . But as [he]65-harry thought of all this [he]65-harry worked away with [his]65-harry bush and [his]65-harry matches , extinguishing the flames here and lighting them there , striving to make a cordon of [black bare ground between [Boolabong]18-boolabong and [Gangoil]65-harry]1952-black bare ground between boolabong and gangoil . Surely [Abraham]91-abraham had never been called on to work like this ! [He]91-abraham and [[his]91-abraham men]726-his men were in a line covering something above a quarter of a mile of ground , of which line [he]91-abraham was [himself]91-abraham [the nearest to [the river]164-the river]1954-the nearest to the river , and [Medlicot]47-medlicot and [[his]47-medlicot foreman]1939-his foreman the farthest from [it]164-the river . [The German]415-the german and [O’Dowd]49-mickey were in the middle , and [Jacko]51-jacko was working with [[his]51-jacko master]337-his master . If [Harry]65-harry had just cause for anger and sorrow in regard to [Nokes]58-nokes and [Boscobel]53-boscobel , [he]65-harry certainly had equal cause to be proud of the stanchness of [his]65-harry remaining satellites . [The men]292-the men worked with a will , as though the whole run had been the personal property of each of [them]292-the men . [Nokes]58-nokes and [Boscobel]53-boscobel would probably have done the same had the fires come before [they]292-the men had quarreled with [[their]292-the men master]1960-their master . It is a small and narrow point that turns [the rushing train]1961-the rushing train to the right or to the left . [The rushing man]1962-the rushing man is often turned off by a point as small and narrow . “[0-i] [My]0-i word ! ” said [Jacko]51-jacko , on a sudden , “[0-i] here [they]1184-they are , [all o ’ horseback]1185-all o ’ horseback ! ” And as [he]51-jacko spoke , there was the sound of [half a dozen horsemen]1963-half a dozen horsemen galloping up to [them]1184-they through the bush . “[0-i] Why , there ’s [Bos]72-bos , [[his]72-bos own self]1186-his own self , ” said [Jacko]51-jacko . [The two leading men]1964-the two leading men were [Joe]79-joe and [Jerry Brownbie]77-jerry , who , for this night only , had composed [their]1964-the two leading men quarrels , and close to [them]1964-the two leading men was [Boscobel]53-boscobel . There were [others behind]1965-others behind , also mounted — [Jack Brownbie]78-jack and [Georgie]43-georgie , and [Nokes]1966-nokes [himself]1966-nokes ; but [they]1964-the two leading men , though [their]1964-the two leading men figures were seen , could not be distinguished in the gloom of the night . Nor , indeed , did [Harry]65-harry at first discern of how many [the party]1967-the party consisted . It seemed that there was [a whole troop of horsemen , whose purpose it]1968-a whole troop of horsemen , whose purpose it was to interrupt [him]65-harry in [his]65-harry work , so that the flames should certainly go ahead . And it was evident that [the men]292-the men thought that [they]292-the men could do so without subjecting [themselves]292-the men to legal penalties . As far as [Harry Heathcote]65-harry could see , [they]292-the men were correct in [their]292-the men view . [He]65-harry could have no right to burn [the grass on [Boolabong]18-boolabong]1970-the grass on boolabong . [He]65-harry had no claim even to be [there]290-there . It was true that [he]65-harry could plead that [he]65-harry was stopping the fire which [they]292-the men had purposely made ; but [they]292-the men could prove [his]65-harry handiwork , whereas it would be almost impossible that [he]65-harry should prove [theirs]292-the men . [The whole forest]1972-the whole forest was not red , but lurid , with the fires , and the air was laden with both the smell and the heat of the conflagration . [The horsemen]1973-the horsemen were dressed , as was [Harry]65-harry [himself]65-harry , in trowsers and shirts , with old slouch hats , and each of [them]1973-the horsemen had a cudgel in [his]65-harry hand . As [they]1973-the horsemen came galloping up through the trees [they]1973-the horsemen were as uncanny and unwelcome [a set of visitors]1974-a set of visitors as [any man]418-any man was ever called on to receive . [Harry]65-harry necessarily stayed [his]65-harry work , and stood still to bear the brunt of the coming attack ; but [Jacko]51-jacko went on with [his]51-jacko employment faster than ever , as though [a troop of men in the dark]1976-a troop of men in the dark were nothing to [him]51-jacko . [Jerry Brownbie]77-jerry was the first to speak . “[72-bos] What ’s this [you]1187-you ’re up to , [Heathcote]65-harry ? Firing [our]1188-our grass ? [It]1189-it ’s arson . [You]1187-you shall swing for this . ” “[1187-you] [I]0-i ’ll take [my]0-i chance of that , ” said [Harry]65-harry , turning to [his]0-i work again . “[0-i] No , [I]0-i ’m blessed if [you]1187-you do . Ride over [him]1190-him , [Bos]72-bos , while [I]0-i stop [these other fellows]1191-these other fellows . ” [The Brownbies]65-harry had been aware that [[Harry]65-harry ’s two boundary riders]1977-harry ’s two boundary riders were with [him]51-jacko , but had not heard of the arrival of [Medlicot]47-medlicot and [the other man]675-the other man . [Nokes]58-nokes was aware that [some one on horseback]1979-some one on horseback had been near [him]51-jacko when [he]51-jacko was firing the grass , but had thought that it was [one of [the party from [Gangoil]65-harry]1981-the party from gangoil]1980-one of the party from gangoil . By the time that [Jerry Brownbie]77-jerry had reached [the German]60-the german , [Medlicot]47-medlicot was there also . “[0-i] Who [the deuce]1192-the deuce are [you]72-bos ? ” asked [Jerry]77-jerry . “[1192-the deuce] What business is that of [yours]72-bos ? ” said [Medlicot]47-medlicot . “[72-bos] No business of mine , and [you]72-bos firing [our]1193-our grass ! [I]0-i ’ll let [you]72-bos know [my]0-i business pretty quickly . ” “[1651-that fellow] It ’s [that fellow]1651-that fellow , [Medlicot]47-medlicot , from [the sugar - mill]419-the sugar - mill , ” said [Joe]79-joe ; “[1651-that fellow] [the man that [Nokes]58-nokes]1196-the man that nokes is with . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i thought [you]72-bos was a horse of another color , ” continued [Jerry]77-jerry , who had been given to understand that [Medlicot]47-medlicot was [[Heathcote]65-harry ’s enemy]1982-heathcote ’s enemy . “[72-bos] Anyway , [I]0-i wo n’t have [my]0-i grass fired . If [God A’mighty]61-god a’mighty chooses to send fires , [we]1193-our ca n’t help it . But [I]0-i ’m not going to have incendiaries here as well . [You]72-bos ’re [a new chum]1197-a new chum , and do n’t understand what [you]72-bos ’re about , but [you]72-bos must stop this . ” As [Medlicot]47-medlicot still went on putting out the fire , [Jerry]77-jerry attempted to ride [him]47-medlicot down . [Medlicot]47-medlicot caught the horse by the rein , and violently backed [the brute]1983-the brute in among the embers . The animal plunged and reared , getting [his]47-medlicot head loose , and at last came down , [he]47-medlicot and [[his]47-medlicot rider]1984-his rider together . In the mean time [Joe Brownbie]79-joe , seeing this , rode up behind [the sugar planter]1985-the sugar planter , and struck [him]47-medlicot violently with [his]79-joe cudgel over the shoulder . [Medlicot]47-medlicot sank nearly to the ground , but at once recovered [himself]47-medlicot . [He]47-medlicot knew that some bone on the left side of [his]47-medlicot body was broken ; but [he]47-medlicot could still fight with [his]47-medlicot right hand , and [he]47-medlicot did fight . [Boscobel]53-boscobel and [Georgie Brownbie]43-georgie both attempted to ride over [Harry]65-harry together , and might have succeeded had not [Jacko]51-jacko ingeniously inserted the burning branch of gum - tree with which [he]51-jacko had been working under the belly of the horse on which [Boscobel]53-boscobel was riding . The animal jumped immediately from the ground , bucking into the air , and [Boscobel]53-boscobel was thrown far over [his]51-jacko head . [Georgie Brownbie]43-georgie then turned upon [Jacko]51-jacko , but [Jacko]51-jacko was far too nimble to be caught , and escaped among the trees . For a few minutes the fight was general , but [the footmen]1986-the footmen had the best of it , in spite of the injury done to [Medlicot]47-medlicot . [Jerry]77-jerry was bruised and burned about the face by [his]77-jerry fall among the ashes , and did not much relish the work afterward . [Boscobel]53-boscobel was stunned for a few moments , and was quite ready to retreat when [he]53-boscobel came to [himself]53-boscobel . [Nokes]58-nokes during the whole time did not show [himself]58-nokes , alleging as a reason afterward the presence of [[his]58-nokes employer]414-his employer [Medlicot]47-medlicot . “[72-bos] [I]0-i ’m blessed if [your]1198-you cowardice sha’n’t hang [you]1198-you , ” said [Joe Brownbie]79-joe to [him]1198-you on [their]1199-we way [home]103-home . “[0-i] Do [you]1198-you think [we]1199-we ’re going to fight the battles of [a fellow like [you]1198-you , who has n’t pluck to come forward [himself]1200-a fellow like you , who has n’t pluck to come forward himself]1200-a fellow like you , who has n’t pluck to come forward himself ? ” “[1200-a fellow like you , who has n’t pluck to come forward himself] [I]0-i ’ve as much pluck as [you]1198-you , ” answered [Nokes]58-nokes , “[0-i] and am ready to fight [you]1198-you any day . But [I]0-i know when [a man]128-a man is to come forward and when [he]128-a man ’s not . Hang [me]0-i ! [I]0-i ’m not so near hanging as [some folks at [Boolabong]18-boolabong]1202-some folks at boolabong . ” [We]1199-we may imagine , therefore , that the night was not spent pleasantly among [the Brownbies]65-harry after these adventures . There were , of course , very much cursing and swearing , and very many threats , before [the party from [Boolabong]18-boolabong]1989-the party from boolabong did retreat . [Their]1989-the party from boolabong great point was , of coarse , this — that [Heathcote]65-harry was willfully firing the grass , and was , therefore , no better than an incendiary . Of course [they]1989-the party from boolabong stoutly denied that the original fire had been intentional , and denied as stoutly that the original fire could be stopped by fires . But at last [they]1989-the party from boolabong went , leaving [Heathcote]65-harry and [[his]65-harry party]1990-his party [masters of [the battle - field]1992-the battle - field]1991-masters of the battle - field . [Jerry]77-jerry was taken away in a sad condition ; and , in subsequent accounts of the transaction given from [Boolabong]18-boolabong , [his]65-harry fall was put forward as the reason of [their]1989-the party from boolabong flight , [he]65-harry having been [the general on the occasion]1993-the general on the occasion . And [Boscobel]53-boscobel had certainly lost all stomach for immediate fighting . Immediately behind [the battle - field]1992-the battle - field [they]1989-the party from boolabong come across [Nokes]58-nokes , and [Sing Sing]54-sing sing , [the runaway cook from [Gangoil]65-harry]1995-the runaway cook from gangoil . [The poor Chinaman]1996-the poor chinaman had made the mistake of joining the party which was not successful . But [Harry]65-harry , though the victory was with [him]65-harry , was hardly in a mood for triumph . [He]65-harry soon found that [Medlicot]47-medlicot ’s collar - bone was broken , and it would be necessary , therefore , that [he]47-medlicot should return with [the wounded man]1997-the wounded man to [the station]249-the station . And the flames , as [he]65-harry feared , had altogether got ahead of [him]65-harry during the fight . As far as [they]1989-the party from boolabong had gone , [they]1989-the party from boolabong had stopped the fire , having made a black wilderness a mile and a half in length , which , during the whole distance , ceased suddenly at the line at which the subsidiary fire had been extinguished . But while the attack was being made upon [them]1989-the party from boolabong the flames had crept on to the southward , and had now got beyond [their]1989-the party from boolabong reach . It had seemed , however , that the mass of fire which had got away from [them]1989-the party from boolabong was small , and already the damp of the night was on the grass ; and [Harry]65-harry felt [himself]65-harry justified in hoping not that there might be no loss , but that the loss might not be ruinous . [Medlicot]47-medlicot consented to be taken back to [Gangoil]65-harry instead of to [the mill]484-the mill . Perhaps [he]47-medlicot thought that [Kate Daly]41-kate might be [a better nurse]2000-a better nurse than [[his]47-medlicot mother]488-his mother , or that the quiet of [the sheep station]2002-the sheep station might be better for [him]47-medlicot than the clatter of [his]47-medlicot own mill - wheels . It was midnight , and [they]1989-the party from boolabong had a ride of fourteen miles , which was hard enough upon [a man with a broken collarbone]2003-a man with a broken collarbone . [The whole party]2004-the whole party also was thoroughly fatigued . The work [they]1989-the party from boolabong had been doing was about as hard as could fall to [a man]128-a man ’s lot , and [they]1989-the party from boolabong had now been many hours without food . Before [they]1989-the party from boolabong started [Mickey]49-mickey produced [his]49-mickey flask , the contents of which were divided equally among [them]1989-the party from boolabong all , including [Jacko]51-jacko . As [they]1989-the party from boolabong were preparing to start [home]103-home [Medlicot]47-medlicot explained that it had struck [him]47-medlicot by degrees that [Heathcote]65-harry might be right in regard to [Nokes]58-nokes , and that [he]47-medlicot had determined to watch [the man]451-the man [himself]47-medlicot whenever [he]47-medlicot should leave [the mill]484-the mill . On that Monday [he]47-medlicot had given up work somewhat earlier than usual , saying that , as the following day was Christmas , [he]47-medlicot should not come to [the mill]484-the mill . From that time [Medlicot]47-medlicot and [[his]47-medlicot foreman]1939-his foreman had watched [him]47-medlicot . “[1202-some folks at boolabong] Yes , ” said [he]0-i , in answer to a question from [Heathcote]65-harry , “[1202-some folks at boolabong] [I]0-i can swear that [I]0-i saw [him]1203-him with the lighted torch in [his]1203-him hand , and that [he]1203-him placed it among the grass . There were [two others from [Boolabong]18-boolabong]1204-two others from boolabong with [him]1203-him , and [they]1204-two others from boolabong must have seen [him]1203-him too . ” When the fight was quite over , and [[Heathcote]65-harry ’s party]2011-heathcote ’s party had returned to [their]2011-heathcote ’s party horses , [Medlicot]47-medlicot for a few minutes was faint and sick , but [he]47-medlicot revived after a while , and declared [himself]47-medlicot able to sit on [his]47-medlicot horse . There was a difficulty in getting [him]47-medlicot up , but when there [he]47-medlicot made no further complaint . “[1204-two others from boolabong] This , ” said [he]47-medlicot , as [he]47-medlicot settled [himself]47-medlicot in [his]47-medlicot saddle , “[1204-two others from boolabong] is [my]0-i first Christmas - day in [Australia]2-australia . [I]0-i landed early in January , and last year [I]0-i was on [my]0-i way [home]103-home to fetch [[my]0-i mother]1103-my mother . ” “[0-i] It ’s not much like an English Christmas , ” said [Harry]65-harry . “[0-i] Nor yet as in [Hanover]33-hanover , ” said [the German]60-the german . “[0-i] It ’s Cork [you]1207-you should go to , or [Galway]34-galway , bedad , if [you]1207-you want to see Christmas kep ’ after the ould fashion , ” said [Mickey]49-mickey . “[0-i] [I]0-i think [we]1208-we used to do it pretty well in [Cumberland]12-cumberland , ” said [Medlicot]47-medlicot . “[0-i] There are things which ca n’t be transplanted . [They]1209-they may have roast beef , and all that , but [you]1207-you should have cold weather to make [you]1207-you feel that it is Christmas indeed . ” “[1208-we] [We]1208-we do it as well as [we]1208-we can , ” [Harry]65-harry pleaded . “[1208-we] [I]0-i ’ve seen a great pudding come into [the room]199-the room all afire — just to remind one of [the old country]501-the old country — when it has been so hot that [one]1423-one could hardly bear a shirt on [one]1423-one ’s shoulders . But yet there ’s something in it . [One]1423-one likes to think of [the old place]1215-the old place , though one is so far away . How do [you]1207-you feel now ? Does the jolting hurt [you]1207-you much ? If [your]1207-you horse is rough , change with [me]0-i . [This fellow]1453-this fellow goes as smooth as [a lady]568-a lady . ” [Medlicot]47-medlicot declared that the pain did not trouble [him]47-medlicot much . “[568-a lady] [They]1218-they ’d have ridden over [us]1208-we , only for [you]1207-you , ” continued [Harry]65-harry . “[1218-they] [My]0-i word ! would n’t [they]1218-they ? ” said [Jacko]51-jacko , who was very proud of [his]51-jacko own part in the battle . “[0-i] [I]0-i say , [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot , did [you]47-medlicot see [Bos]72-bos and [his]72-bos horse part company ? [You]47-medlicot did , [Mr. Harry]37-harry . Did n’t [he]72-bos fly like a bird , all in among the bushes ! [I]0-i owed [Bos]72-bos one ; [I]0-i did , [my]0-i word ! And now [I]0-i ’ve paid [him]72-bos . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i saw it , ” said [Harry]37-harry . “[72-bos] [He]72-bos was riding at [me]0-i as hard as [he]72-bos could come . [I]0-i ca n’t understand [Boscobel]53-boscobel . [Nokes]58-nokes is [a sly , bad , slinking follow , whom [I]0-i never liked]1219-a sly , bad , slinking follow , whom i never liked . But [I]0-i was always good to [Bos]72-bos ; and when [he]72-bos cheated [me]0-i , as [he]72-bos did , about [his]72-bos time , [I]0-i never even threatened to stop [his]72-bos money . ” “[0-i] [You]1220-you told [him]72-bos of it too plain , ” said [the German]60-the german . “[1220-you] [I]0-i did tell [him]72-bos — of course — as [I]0-i should [you]1220-you . It has come to that now , that if [a man]128-a man robs [you]1220-you — [[your]1220-you own man]1222-your own man — [you]1220-you are not to dare to tell [him]128-a man of it ! What would [you]1220-you think of [me]0-i , [Karl]59-karl bender , if [I]0-i were to find [you]1220-you out , and was to be afraid of speaking to [you]1220-you , lest [you]1220-you should turn against [me]0-i and burn [my]0-i fences ? ” [Karl Bender]59-karl bender shrugged [his]59-karl bender shoulders , holding [his]59-karl bender reins up to [his]59-karl bender eyes . “[0-i] [I]0-i know what [you]1220-you ought to think ! And [I]0-i wish that [every man about [Gangoil]65-harry]1223-every man about gangoil should be sure that [I]0-i will always say what [I]0-i think right . [I]0-i do n’t know that [I]0-i ever was hard upon [any man]418-any man . [I]0-i try not to be . ” “[0-i] Thrue for [you]1220-you , [Mr. Harry]37-harry , ” said [the Irishman]756-the irishman . “[37-harry] [I]0-i ’m not going to pick [my]0-i words because [men like [Nokes]58-nokes and [Boscobel]53-boscobel]1225-men like nokes and boscobel have the power of injuring [me]0-i . [I]0-i ’m not going to truckle to rascals because [I]0-i ’m afraid of [them]1225-men like nokes and boscobel . [I]0-i ’d sooner be burned out of [house]1556-house and [home]103-home , and go and work on [the wharves in [Brisbane]7-brisbane]1228-the wharves in brisbane , than that . ” “[0-i] [My]0-i word ! yes , ” said [Jacko]51-jacko , “[0-i] and [I]0-i too . ” “[0-i] If [the devil]1229-the devil is to get ahead , [he]1229-the devil must , but [I]0-i wo n’t hold a candle to [him]1229-the devil . [[You]1230-you fellows]1656-you fellows may tell [every man]427-every man about [the place]1437-the place what [I]0-i say . As long as [I]0-i ’m master of Gangoil [I]0-i ’ll be [master]169-master ; and when [I]0-i come across a swindle [I]0-i ’ll tell [the man who does it]1235-the man who does it [he]1235-the man who does it ’s [a swindler]1670-a swindler . [I]0-i told [Bos]72-bos to [his]72-bos face ; but [I]0-i did n’t tell [any body else]1237-any body else , and [I]0-i should n’t if [he]72-bos ’d taken it right and mended [his]72-bos ways . ” [They]1656-you fellows all understood [him]0-i very well — [the German]415-the german , [the Irishman]756-the irishman , [[Medlicot]47-medlicot ’s foreman]2015-medlicot ’s foreman , [Medlicot]47-medlicot [himself]47-medlicot , and even [Jacko]51-jacko ; and though , no doubt , there was a feeling within the hearts of the men that [Harry Heathcote]65-harry was imperious , still [they]1656-you fellows respected [him]0-i , and [they]1656-you fellows believed [him]0-i . “[0-i] [The masther]1238-the masther should be [the masther]1238-the masther , no doubt , ” said [the Irishman]756-the irishman . “[1238-the masther] [A man that is [a man]128-a man]1240-a man that is a man vill not sell hisself body and soul , ” said [the German]415-the german , slowly . “[1238-the masther] Do [I]0-i want dominion over [your]0-i soul , [Karl Bender]59-karl bender ? ” asked [the squatter]503-the squatter , with energy . “[59-karl bender] [You]0-i know [I]0-i do n’t , nor over [your]0-i body , except so far as it suits [you]0-i to sell [your]0-i services . What [you]0-i sell [you]0-i part with readily — like [a man]128-a man ; and it ’s not likely that [you]0-i and [I]0-i shall quarrel . But all this row about nothing ca n’t be very pleasant to [a man with a broken shoulder]1243-a man with a broken shoulder . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i like to hear [you]0-i , ” said [Medlicot]47-medlicot . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m always [a good listener]1244-a good listener when [men]130-men have something really to say . ” “[130-men] Well , then , [I]0-i ’ve something to say , ” cried [Harry]65-harry . “[0-i] There never was [a man]128-a man came to [[my]0-i house]1247-my house whom [I]0-i ’d sooner see as [a Christmas guest]1248-a christmas guest than [yourself]0-i . ” “[128-a man] Thankee , [Sir]1648-sir . ” “[1648-sir] It ’s more than [I]0-i could have said yesterday with truth . ” “[0-i] It ’s more than [you]0-i did say . ” “[0-i] Yes , by [George]43-georgie ! But [you]0-i ’ve beat [me]0-i now . When [you]0-i ’re hard pressed for hands down yonder , [you]0-i send for [me]0-i , and see if [I]0-i wo n’t turn the mill for [you]0-i , or hoe canes either . ” “[0-i] So ‘ ll [I]0-i ; [my]0-i word ! yes . Just for [my]0-i rations . ” [They]2019-they had by this time reacted the Gangoil fence , having taken the directest route for [the house]226-the house . But [Harry]65-harry , in doing this , had not been unmindful of the fire . Had [Medlicot]47-medlicot not been wounded , [he]65-harry would have taken [the party]1967-the party somewhat out of the way , down southward , following the flames ; but [Medlicot]47-medlicot ’s condition had made [him]65-harry feel that [he]65-harry would not be justified in doing so . Now , however , it occurred to [him]65-harry that [he]65-harry might as well ride a mile or two down the fence , and see what injury had been done . [The escort of [the men]292-the men]2022-the escort of the men would be sufficient to take [Medlicot]47-medlicot to [the station]249-the station , and [he]65-harry would reach [the place]1437-the place as soon as [they]292-the men . If the flames were still running ahead , [he]65-harry knew that [he]65-harry could not now stop then , but [he]65-harry could at least learn how the matter stood with [him]65-harry . If the worst came to the worst , [he]65-harry would not now lose more than three or four miles of fencing , and the grass off a corner of [his]65-harry run . Nevertheless , tired as [he]65-harry was , [he]65-harry could not bear the idea of going [home]103-home without knowing the whole story . So [he]65-harry made [his]65-harry proposal . [Medlicot]47-medlicot , of course , made no objection . [Each of [the men]292-the men]2027-each of the men offered to go with [him]47-medlicot , but [he]47-medlicot declined [their]292-the men services . “[0-i] There is nothing to do , ” said [he]47-medlicot , “[1250-nobody to catch] and [nobody to catch]1250-nobody to catch ; and if the fire is burning , it must burn . ” So [he]47-medlicot went alone . The words that [he]65-harry had uttered among [[his]65-harry men]726-his men had not been lightly spoken . [He]65-harry had begun to perceive that life would be very hard to [him]65-harry in [his]65-harry present position , or perhaps altogether impossible , as long as [he]65-harry was at enmity with [all those around [him]65-harry]2030-all those around him . [Old squatters whom [he]65-harry knew]2031-old squatters whom he knew , [respectable men who had been in [the colony]146-the colony before [he]65-harry was born]2032-respectable men who had been in the colony before he was born , had advised [him]65-harry to be on good terms with [the Brownbies]65-harry . “[1251-you] [You]1251-you need n’t ask [them]1252-them to [[your]1251-you house]1253-your house , or go to [them]1252-them , but just soft - sawder [them]1252-them when [yon]1251-you meet , ” [an old gentleman]2034-an old gentleman had said to [him]65-harry . [He]65-harry certainly had n’t taken [the old gentleman]2035-the old gentleman ’s advice , thinking that to “[1252-them] soft - sawder ” so great a reprobate as [Jerry Brownbie]77-jerry would be holding a candle to the devil . But [his]65-harry own plan had hardly answered . Well , [he]65-harry was sure , at any rate , of this — that [he]65-harry could do no good now by endeavoring to be civil to [the Brownbies]65-harry . [He]65-harry soon came to the place where the fire had reached [[his]65-harry fence]2036-his fence , and found that it had burned its way through , and that the flames were still continuing their onward course . The fence to the north , or rather to the northwestward — the point whence the wind was coming — stood firm at the spot at which the fire had struck it . Dry as the wood was , the flames had not traveled upward against the wind . But to the south the fire was traveling down the fence . To stop this [he]65-harry rode half a mile along the burning barrier till [he]65-harry had headed the flames , and then [he]65-harry pulled the bushes down and rolled away the logs , so as to stop the destruction . As regarded [[his]65-harry fence]2036-his fence , there was less than a mile of [it]2036-his fence destroyed , and that [he]65-harry could now leave in security , as the wind was blowing away from [it]2036-his fence . As for [his]65-harry grass , that must now take its chance . [He]65-harry could see the dark light of the low running fire ; but there was no longer a mighty blaze , and [he]65-harry knew that the dew of the night was acting as [[his]65-harry protector]2038-his protector . The harm that had been as yet done was trifling , if only [he]65-harry could protect [himself]65-harry from further harm . After leaving the fire , [he]65-harry had still a ride of seven or eight miles through the gloom of [the forest]361-the forest — all alone . Not only was [he]65-harry weary , but [his]65-harry horse was so tired that [he]65-harry could hardly get [him]65-harry to canter for a furlong . [He]65-harry regretted that [he]65-harry had not brought [the boy]375-the boy with [him]65-harry , knowing well the service of companionship to [a tired beast]2041-a tired beast . [He]65-harry was used to such troubles , and could always tell [himself]65-harry that [his]65-harry back was broad enough to bear them ; but [his]65-harry desolation among [enemies]1464-enemies oppressed [him]65-harry . [Medlicot]47-medlicot , however , was no longer [an enemy]578-an enemy . Then there came across [his]65-harry mind for the first time an idea that [Medlicot]47-medlicot might marry [[his]47-medlicot sister - in - law]183-his sister - in - law , and become [[his]47-medlicot fast friend]2045-his fast friend . If [he]65-harry could have but [one true friend]2046-one true friend , [he]65-harry thought that [he]65-harry could bear the enmity of all [the Brownbies]65-harry . Hitherto [he]65-harry had been entirely alone in [his]65-harry anxiety . It was between three and four when [he]65-harry reached [Gangoil]65-harry , and [he]65-harry found that the party of [horsemen]2047-horsemen had just entered [the yard]641-the yard before [him]65-harry . [The sugar planter]1985-the sugar planter was so weak that [he]1985-the sugar planter could hardly get off [his]1985-the sugar planter horse . [The two ladies]196-the two ladies were still watching when [the cavalcade]2051-the cavalcade arrived , though it was then between three and four in the morning . It was [Harry]65-harry ’s custom on such occasions to ride up to the little gate close to [the veranda]174-the veranda , and there to hang [his]65-harry bridle till [some one]599-some one should take [his]65-harry horse away ; but on this occasion [he]65-harry and [the others]983-the others rode into [the yard]641-the yard . Seeing this , [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote and [[her]42-mrs. heathcote sister]180-her sister went through [the house]226-the house , and soon learned how things were . [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot , from [the mill]484-the mill , had come with a bone broken , and it was [their]196-the two ladies duty to nurse [him]47-medlicot till [a doctor]2059-a doctor could be procured from [Maryborough]35-maryborough . Now [Maryborough]35-maryborough was thirty miles distant . [Some one]599-some one must be dispatched at once . [Jacko]51-jacko volunteered , but in such a service [Jacko]51-jacko was hardly to be trusted . [He]51-jacko might fall asleep on [his]51-jacko horse , and continue [his]51-jacko slumbers on [the ground]606-the ground . [Mickey]49-mickey and [the German]415-the german both offered ; but [the men]292-the men were so beaten by [their]292-the men work that [Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote did not dare to take [their]292-the men offer . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]1254-you what it is , [Mary]40-mary , ” [he]0-i said to [[his]0-i wife]104-his wife , “[40-mary] there is nothing for it but for [me]0-i to go for [Jackson]85-jackson . ” [Jackson]85-jackson was [the doctor]2065-the doctor . “[85-jackson] And [I]0-i can see [the police]1255-the police at the same time . ” “[85-jackson] [You]0-i sha’n’t go , [Harry]65-harry . [Yon]0-i are so tired already [you]0-i can hardly stand this moment . ” “[85-jackson] Get [me]0-i some strong coffee — at once . [You]0-i do n’t know what [that man]1560-that man has done for [us]1257-us . [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]0-i all another time . [I]0-i owe [him]1560-that man more than a ride into [Maryborough]35-maryborough . [I]0-i ’ll make [the men]292-the men get [Yorkie]93-yorkie up”—Yorkie was a favorite horse [he]1560-that man had—“while[0-i] [you]0-i make the coffee ; and [I]0-i ’ll lead [Colonel”—Colonel]94-colonel”—colonel was another horse , well esteemed at [Gangoil]65-harry . “[85-jackson] [Jackson]85-jackson will come quicker on [him]1560-that man than on any animal [he]1560-that man can get at [Maryborough]35-maryborough . ” And so it was arranged , in spite of [the wife]108-the wife ’s tears and entreaties . [Harry]65-harry had [his]65-harry coffee and some food , and started , with [his]65-harry two horses , for [the doctor]2065-the doctor . [Nature]95-nature is so good to [us]2068-we that [we]2068-we are sometimes disposed to think [we]2068-we might have dispensed with art . In the bush , where [doctors]2069-doctors can not be had , bones will set themselves ; and when [doctors]2069-doctors do come , but come slowly , the broken bones suit themselves to such tardiness . [Medlicot]47-medlicot was brought in and put to bed . Let [the reader]117-the reader not be shocked to hear that [[Kate Daly]41-kate ’s room]2072-kate daly ’s room was given up to [him]47-medlicot , as being best suited for [a sick man]2073-a sick man ’s comfort , and [the two ladies]196-the two ladies took it in turn to watch [him]47-medlicot . [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote was , of course , [the first]2075-the first , and remained with [him]47-medlicot till dawn . Then [Kate]41-kate crept to the door and asked whether [she]41-kate should relieve [[her]41-kate sister]180-her sister . [Medlicot]47-medlicot was asleep , and it was agreed that [Kate]41-kate should remain in [the veranda]174-the veranda , and look in from time to time to see whether [the wounded man]1997-the wounded man required aught at [her]41-kate hands . [She]41-kate looked in very often , and then , at last , [he]47-medlicot was awake . “[66-miss daly] [Miss Daly]66-miss daly , ” [he]0-i said , “[66-miss daly] [I]0-i feel so ashamed of the trouble [I]0-i ’m giving . ” “[66-miss daly] Do n’t speak of it . It is nothing . In [the bush]218-the bush [every body]1260-every body , of course , does any thing for every body . ” When the words were spoken [she]41-kate felt that they were not as complimentary as [she]41-kate would have wished . “[66-miss daly] [You]66-miss daly were to have come to - day , [you]66-miss daly know , but [we]1261-we did not think [you]66-miss daly ’d come like this , did [we]1261-we ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know why [I]0-i did n’t go [home]103-home instead of coming [here]260-here . ” “[2065-the doctor] [The doctor]2065-the doctor will reach [Gangoil]65-harry sooner than [he]2065-the doctor could [the mill]484-the mill . [You]66-miss daly are better [here]260-here , and [we]1261-we will send for [Mrs. Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot as soon as [the men]292-the men have had a rest . How was it all , [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot ? [Harry]65-harry says that there was a fight , and that [you]66-miss daly came in just at the nick of time , and that but for [you]66-miss daly all the run would have been burned . ” “[65-harry] Not that at all . ” “[65-harry] [He]65-harry said so ; only [he]65-harry went off so quickly , and was so busy with things , that [we]1261-we hardly understood [him]65-harry . Is it not dreadful that there should be such fighting ? And then these horrid fires ! [You]66-miss daly were in the middle of the fire , were [you]66-miss daly not ? ” It suited [Kate]41-kate ’s feelings that [Medlicot]47-medlicot should be [the hero of this occasion]2079-the hero of this occasion . “[66-miss daly] [We]1261-we were lighting them in front to put them out behind . ” “[1261-we] And then , while [you]66-miss daly were at work , [these men from [Boolabong]18-boolabong]1268-these men from boolabong came upon [you]66-miss daly . Oh , [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot , [we]1261-we shall be so very , very wretched if [you]66-miss daly are much hurt . [[My]0-i sister]1095-my sister is so unhappy about it . ” “[1095-my sister] It ’s only [my]0-i collar - bone , [Miss Daly]66-miss daly . ” “[66-miss daly] But that is so dreadful . ” [She]41-kate was still thinking of the one word [he]47-medlicot had spoken when [he]47-medlicot had — well , not asked [her]41-kate for [her]41-kate love , but said that which between [a young man]2080-a young man and [a young woman]2081-a young woman ought to mean the same thing . Perhaps it had meant nothing ! [She]41-kate had heard that [young men]136-young men do say things which mean nothing . But to [her]41-kate , living in [the solitude of [Gangoil]65-harry]2083-the solitude of gangoil , the one word had been so much ! [Her]41-kate heart had melted with absolute acknowledged love when [the man]451-the man had been brought through into [the house]226-the house with all the added attraction of a broken bone . While [[her]41-kate sister]180-her sister had watched , [she]41-kate had retired — to rest , as [Mary]40-mary had said , but in truth to think of the chance which had brought [her]41-kate in this guise into familiar contact with [the man [she]41-kate loved]2087-the man she loved . And then , when [she]41-kate had crept up to take [her]41-kate place in watching [him]2087-the man she loved , [she]41-kate had almost felt that shame should restrain [her]41-kate . But was [her]41-kate duty ; and , of course , [a man with a collar - bone broken]2088-a man with a collar - bone broken would not speak of love . “[66-miss daly] It will make [your]1270-you Christmas so sad for [you]1270-you , ” [he]2087-the man she loved said . “[66-miss daly] Oh , as for that , [we]1271-we mind nothing about it — for [ourselves]1271-we . [We]1271-we are never very gay [here]260-here . ” “[1271-we] But [you]1270-you are happy ? ” “[1270-you] Oh yes , quite happy , except when [Harry]65-harry is disturbed by these troubles . [I]0-i do n’t think [any body]1471-any body has so many troubles as [a squatter]1419-a squatter . It sometimes seems that all [the world]1427-the world is against [him]65-harry . ” “[1271-we] [We]1271-we shall be [allies]1276-allies now , at any rate . ” “[1271-we] Oh , [I]0-i do so hope [we]1271-we shall , ” said [Kate]41-kate , putting [her]41-kate hands together in [her]41-kate energy , and then retreating from [her]41-kate energy with sad awkwardness when [she]41-kate remembered the personal application of [her]41-kate wish . “[0-i] That is , [I]0-i mean [you]1270-you and [Harry]65-harry , ” [she]41-kate added , in a whisper . “[1270-you] Why not [I]0-i and others besides [Harry]65-harry ? ” “[1270-you] It is so much to [him]65-harry to have [a real friend]1277-a real friend . Things concern [us]1271-we , of course , only just as they concern [him]65-harry . [Women]403-women are never of very much account , [I]0-i think . [Harry]65-harry has to do every thing , and every thing ought to be done for [him]65-harry . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]0-i spoil [Harry]65-harry among [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] Do n’t [you]0-i say so to [Mary]40-mary , or [she]40-mary will be fierce . ” “[40-mary] [I]0-i wonder whether [I]0-i shall ever have [a wife]1097-a wife to stand up for [me]0-i in that way ? ” [Kate]41-kate had no answer to make , but [she]41-kate thought that it would be [his]65-harry own fault if [he]65-harry did not have [a wife]1097-a wife to stand up for [him]65-harry thoroughly . “[1097-a wife] [He]65-harry has been very lucky in [[his]65-harry wife]104-his wife . ” “[65-harry] [I]0-i think [he]65-harry has , [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot ; but [you]0-i are moving about , and [you]0-i ought to lie still . There ! [I]0-i hear the horses ; that ’s [the doctor]2065-the doctor . [I]0-i do so hope [he]65-harry wo n’t say that any thing very bad is the matter . ” [She]41-kate jumped up from [her]41-kate chair , which was close to [his]65-harry bed , and as [she]41-kate did so just touched [his]65-harry hand with [hers]41-kate . It was involuntary on [her]41-kate part , having come of instinct rather than will , and [she]41-kate withdrew [herself]41-kate instantly . The hand [she]41-kate had touched belonged to the arm that was not hurt , and [he]65-harry put it out after [her]41-kate , and caught [her]41-kate by the sleeve as [she]41-kate was retreating . “[65-harry] Oh , [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot , [you]0-i must not do that ; [you]0-i will hurt [yourself]0-i if [you]0-i move in that way . ” And so [she]41-kate escaped , and left [the room]199-the room , and did not see [him]65-harry again till [the doctor]2065-the doctor had gone from [Gangoil]65-harry . The bone had been broken simply as other bones are broken ; it was now set , and [the sufferer]2092-the sufferer was , of course , told that [he]2092-the sufferer must rest . [He]65-harry had suggested that [he]65-harry should be taken [home]103-home , and [the Heathcotes]52-the heathcotes had concurred with [the doctor]2065-the doctor in asserting that no proposition could be more absurd . [He]65-harry had intended to eat [his]65-harry Christmas dinner at [Gangoil]65-harry , and [he]65-harry must now pass [his]65-harry entire Christmas [there]290-there . “[47-medlicot] The sugar can go on very well for ten days , ” [Harry]65-harry had said . “[47-medlicot] [I]0-i ’ll go over [myself]0-i and see about [the men]292-the men , and [I]0-i ’ll fetch [[your]1283-your mother]1102-your mother over . ” To this , however , [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote had demurred successfully . “[0-i] [You]0-i ’ll kill [yourself]0-i , [Harry]65-harry , if [you]65-harry go on like this , ” [she]42-mrs. heathcote said . [Bender]59-karl bender , therefore , was sent in the buggy for [the old lady]524-the old lady , and at last [Harry Heathcote]65-harry consented to go to bed . “[65-harry] [My]0-i belief is , [I]0-i shall sleep for a week , ” [he]0-i said , as [he]0-i turned in . But [he]0-i did n’t begin [his]0-i sleep quite at once . “[0-i] [I]0-i am very glad [I]0-i went into [Maryborough]35-maryborough , ” [he]0-i said to [[his]0-i wife]104-his wife , rising up from [his]0-i pillow . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’ve sworn an information against [Nokes]58-nokes and [two of [the Brownbies]65-harry]1285-two of the brownbies , and [the police]1255-the police will be after [them]1287-them this afternoon .
