And , [Mary]40-mary , look here ; do [you]40-mary know [I]0-i should n’t be a bit surprised if [that fellow]1651-that fellow was to be making up to [Kate]41-kate . ” [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote , with some little inward chuckle at [[her]42-mrs. heathcote husband]116-her husband ’s assumed quickness of apprehension , reminded [herself]42-mrs. heathcote that the same idea had occurred to [her]42-mrs. heathcote some time ago . [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote gave [[her]42-mrs. heathcote husband]116-her husband full credit for more than ordinary intelligence in reference to affairs appertaining to the breeding of sheep and the growing of wool , but [she]42-mrs. heathcote did not think highly of [his]116-her husband discernment in such an affair as this . [She]42-mrs. heathcote [herself]42-mrs. heathcote had been much quicker . When [she]42-mrs. heathcote first saw [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot , [she]42-mrs. heathcote had felt it [a godsend]2100-a godsend that [such a man , with the look of a gentleman , and unmarried]2101-such a man , with the look of a gentleman , and unmarried , should come into [the neighborhood]1559-the neighborhood ; and , in so feeling , [her]42-mrs. heathcote heart had been entirely with [[her]42-mrs. heathcote sister]180-her sister . For [herself]42-mrs. heathcote it mattered nothing who came or did not come , or whether [a man]128-a man were [a bachelor]2105-a bachelor , or possessed of [a wife]1097-a wife and [a dozen children]2107-a dozen children . All that [a girl]2108-a girl had a right to want was [a good husband]2109-a good husband . [She]42-mrs. heathcote was quite satisfied with [her]42-mrs. heathcote own lot in that respect , but [she]42-mrs. heathcote was anxious enough on behalf of [Kate]41-kate . And when [a young man]2080-a young man did come , who might make matters so pleasant for [them]2111-them , [Harry]65-harry quarreled with [him]65-harry because [he]65-harry was [a free - selector]1432-a free - selector . “[1651-that fellow] [A free fiddle - stick]1296-a free fiddle - stick ! ” [she]42-mrs. heathcote had once said to [Kate]41-kate — not , however , communicating to [[her]42-mrs. heathcote innocent sister]2113-her innocent sister the ambition which was already filling [her]42-mrs. heathcote own bosom . “[65-harry] [Harry]65-harry does take things up so — as though [people]1472-people were n’t to live , some in one way and some in another ! As far as [I]0-i can see , [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot is [a very nice fellow]1298-a very nice fellow . ” [Kate]41-kate had remarked that [he]47-medlicot was “[1298-a very nice fellow] all very well , ” and nothing more had been said . But [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote , in spite of [Harry]65-harry ’s aversion , had formed [her]42-mrs. heathcote little project — a project which , if then declared , would have filled [Harry]65-harry with dismay . And now [the young aristocrat]2114-the young aristocrat , as [he]2114-the young aristocrat turned [himself]2114-the young aristocrat in [his]2114-the young aristocrat bed , made the suggestion to [[his]2114-the young aristocrat wife]104-his wife as though it were all [his]2114-the young aristocrat own ! “[1298-a very nice fellow] [I]0-i never like to think much of these things beforehand , ” [she]104-his wife said , innocently . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know about thinking , ” said [Harry]65-harry ; “[0-i] but [a girl]2108-a girl might do worse . If it should come up , do n’t set [yourself]0-i against it . ” “[41-kate] [Kate]41-kate , of course , will please [herself]41-kate , ” said [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote . “[41-kate] Now do lie down and rest [yourself]0-i . ” [His]2114-the young aristocrat rest , however , was not of long duration . As [he]2114-the young aristocrat had [himself]2114-the young aristocrat suggested , [two policemen]2116-two policemen reached [Gangoil]65-harry at about three in the afternoon , on [their]2116-two policemen way from [Maryborough]35-maryborough to [Boolabong]18-boolabong , in order that [they]2116-two policemen might take [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot ’s deposition . After [Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote ’s departure it had occurred to [[Sergeant Forrest]96-sergeant forrest of [the police]1255-the police]2117-sergeant forrest of the police — and the suggestion , having been transferred from [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant to [the stipendiary magistrate]2120-the stipendiary magistrate , was now produced with magisterial sanction — that , after all , there was no evidence against [the Brownbies]65-harry . [They]2116-two policemen had simply interfered to prevent the burning of the grass on [their]2116-two policemen own run , and who could say that [they]2116-two policemen had committed any crime by doing so ? If [Medlicot]47-medlicot had seen [Nokes]58-nokes with a lighted branch in [his]47-medlicot hand , the matter might be different with [him]47-medlicot ; and therefore [Medlicot]47-medlicot ’s deposition was taken . [He]47-medlicot had sworn that [he]47-medlicot had seen [Nokes]58-nokes drag [his]58-nokes lighted torch along the ground ; [he]47-medlicot had also seen other horsemen — two or three , as [he]47-medlicot thought — but could not identify [them]2121-them . [Jacko]51-jacko ’s deposition was also taken as to [the man who had been heard and seen in the wool - shed]2122-the man who had been heard and seen in the wool - shed at night . [Jacko]51-jacko was ready to swear point - blank that [the man]451-the man was [Nokes]58-nokes . [The policemen]2124-the policemen suggested that , as the night was dark , [Jacko]51-jacko might as well allow a shade of doubt to appear , thinking that the shade of doubt would add strength to the evidence . But [Jacko]51-jacko was not going to be taught what sort of oath [he]51-jacko should swear . “[0-i] [My]0-i word ! ” [he]51-jacko said . “[0-i] Did n’t [I]0-i see [his]1300-his leg move ? [You]1301-you go away . ” Armed with these depositions , [the two constables]2125-the two constables went on to [Boolabong]18-boolabong in search of [Nokes]58-nokes , and of [Nokes]58-nokes only , much to the chagrin of [Harry]65-harry , who declared that [the police]1255-the police would never really bestir [themselves]1255-the police in [a squatter]1419-a squatter ’s cause . “[1301-you] As for [Nokes]58-nokes , [he]58-nokes ’ll be out of [Queensland]5-queensland by this time to - morrow . ” [The Brownbie party]2128-the brownbie party returned , after [their]2128-the brownbie party midnight raid , in great discomfiture to [Boolabong]18-boolabong . [[Their]2128-the brownbie party leader]2129-their leader , [Jerry]77-jerry , was burned about [his]77-jerry hands and face in a disagreeable and unsightly manner . [Joe]79-joe had hardly made good that character for “[58-nokes] fighting it out to the end ” for which [he]79-joe was apt to claim credit . [Boscobel]53-boscobel was altogether disconcerted by [his]53-boscobel fall . [And Nokes]58-nokes , who had certainly shown no aptitude for the fray , was abused by [them]2128-the brownbie party all as having caused [their]2128-the brownbie party retreat by [his]58-nokes cowardice ; while [Sing Sing]54-sing sing , [the runaway cook , who knew that [he]54-sing sing had forfeited [his]54-sing sing wages at [Gangoil]65-harry]2130-the runaway cook , who knew that he had forfeited his wages at gangoil , was forced to turn over in [his]54-sing sing heathenish mind the ill effects of joining the losing side . “[1302-you] [[You]1302-you big fool]1303-you big fool , [Bos]72-bos , ” [he]54-sing sing said more than once to [[his]54-sing sing friend]498-his friend [the woodsman , who had lured [him]54-sing sing away from the comforts of [Gangoil]65-harry]2132-the woodsman , who had lured him away from the comforts of gangoil . “[1302-you] [I]0-i ’ll punch [your]1302-you head , [John]97-john , if [you]1302-you do n’t hold [your]1302-you row , ” [Boscobel]53-boscobel would reply . But [Sing Sing]54-sing sing went on with [his]54-sing sing reproaches , and , before [they]2133-they had reached [Boolabong]18-boolabong , [Boscobel]53-boscobel had punched [the Chinaman]2134-the chinaman ’s head . “[1302-you] [You]1302-you ’re not coming in [here]260-here , ” [Jerry]77-jerry said to [Nokes]58-nokes , when [they]2133-they reached [the yard gate]2135-the yard gate . “[1302-you] Who wants to come in ? [I]0-i suppose [you]1302-you ’re not going to send [a fellow]1504-a fellow on without a bit of grub after such a night ’s work ? ” “[1302-you] Give [him]1504-a fellow some bread and meat , [Jack]78-jack , and let [him]1504-a fellow go on . There ’ll be somebody here after [him]1504-a fellow before long . [He]1504-a fellow ca n’t hurt [us]1306-we ; but [I]0-i do n’t want [people]1472-people to think that [we]1306-we are so fond of [him]1504-a fellow that [we]1306-we ca n’t do without harboring [him]1504-a fellow here . [Georgie]43-georgie , [you]43-georgie ’ll go too , if [you]43-georgie take [my]0-i advice . [That young cur]1308-that young cur will send [the police]1255-the police here as sure as [my]0-i name is [Brownbie]43-georgie , and , if [they]1255-the police once get hold of [you]43-georgie , [they]1255-the police ’ll have a great many things to talk to [you]43-georgie about . ” [Georgie]43-georgie grumbled when [he]43-georgie heard this , but [he]43-georgie knew that the advice given [him]43-georgie was good , and [he]43-georgie did not attempt to enter [the house]226-the house . So [Nokes]58-nokes and [he]1504-a fellow vanished , away into the bush together — as [such men]2137-such men do vanish — wandering forth to live as the wild beasts live . It was still a dark night when [they]1255-the police went , and [the remainder of the party]2138-the remainder of the party took [themselves]2138-the remainder of the party to [their]2138-the remainder of the party beds . On the following afternoon [they]1255-the police were lying about [the house]226-the house , sometimes sleeping , and sometimes waking up to smoke , when [the two policemen , who had already been at [Gangoil]65-harry]2140-the two policemen , who had already been at gangoil , appeared in [the yard]641-the yard . [These men]802-these men were dressed in flat caps , with short blue jackets , hunting breeches , and long black boots — very unlike [any policemen in [the old country]501-the old country]2143-any policemen in the old country , and much more picturesque . [They]802-these men leisurely tied [their]802-these men horses up , as though [they]802-these men had been in the habit of making weekly visits to [the place]1437-the place , and walked round to [the veranda]174-the veranda . “[1255-the police] Well , [Mr. Brownbie]83-mr. brownbie , and how are [you]83-mr. brownbie ? ” said [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant to [the old man]763-the old man . [The head of [the family]257-the family]2149-the head of the family was gracious , and declared [himself]2149-the head of the family to be pretty well , considering all things . [He]2149-the head of the family called [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant by [his]2119-the sergeant name , and asked [the men]292-the men whether [they]292-the men ’d take a bit of something to eat . [Joe]79-joe also was courteous , and , after a little delay in getting a key from [[his]79-joe brother]2153-his brother , brought out the jar of spirits , which , in the bush , is regarded as the best sign known of thorough good - breeding . [The sergeant]2119-the sergeant said that [he]2119-the sergeant did n’t mind if [he]2119-the sergeant did ; and [the other man]675-the other man , of course , followed [[his]675-the other man officer]2156-his officer ’s example . So far every thing was comfortable , and [the constables]2157-the constables seemed in no hurry to allude to [disagreeable subjects]2158-disagreeable subjects . [They]2157-the constables condescended to eat a bit of cold meat before [they]2157-the constables proceeded to business . And at last the matter to be discussed was first introduced by [one of [the Brownbie family]973-the brownbie family]2159-one of the brownbie family . “[83-mr. brownbie] [I]0-i suppose [you]1310-you ’ve heard that there was a scrimmage here last night , ” said [Joe]79-joe . [The Brownbie party present]2161-the brownbie party present consisted of [the old man]763-the old man , [Joe]79-joe and [Jack Brownbie]78-jack , and [Boscobel]53-boscobel , [Jerry]77-jerry keeping [himself]77-jerry in the background because of [his]77-jerry disfigurement . [The sergeant]2119-the sergeant , as [he]2119-the sergeant swallowed [his]2119-the sergeant food , acknowledged that [he]2119-the sergeant had heard something about it . “[1310-you] And that ’s what brings [you]1310-you here , ” continued [Joe]79-joe . “[1310-you] There ai n’t nothing wrong here , ” said [old Brownbie]79-joe . “[0-i] [I]0-i hope not , [Mr. Brownbie]83-mr. brownbie , ” said [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant . “[83-mr. brownbie] [I]0-i hope not . [We]1311-we have n’t got any thing against [you]83-mr. brownbie , at any rate . ” [Sergeant Forrest]96-sergeant forrest was [a graduate of [Oxford]36-oxford]2165-a graduate of oxford , [the son of [an English clergyman]2167-an english clergyman , who , having [his]2167-an english clergyman way to make in [the world]1427-the world , had thought that an early fortune would be found in [the colonies]828-the colonies]2166-the son of an english clergyman , who , having his way to make in the world , had thought that an early fortune would be found in the colonies . [He]96-sergeant forrest had come out , had failed , had suffered some very hard things , and now , at the age of thirty - five , enjoyed life thoroughly as [a sergeant of [the colonial police]2171-the colonial police]2170-a sergeant of the colonial police . “[1311-we] [You]1310-you have n’t got any thing against [anybody]1312-anybody here , [I]0-i should think ? ” said [Joe]79-joe . “[0-i] If [you]83-mr. brownbie want to get [them]1313-them as begun it , ” said [Jack]78-jack , “[0-i] and [them]1313-them as ought to be took up , [you]83-mr. brownbie ’ll go to [Gangoil]65-harry . ” “[83-mr. brownbie] Hold [your]83-mr. brownbie tongue , [Jack]78-jack , ” said [[his]78-jack brother]2153-his brother . “[78-jack] [Sergeant Forrest]96-sergeant forrest knows where to go better than [you]83-mr. brownbie can tell [him]96-sergeant forrest . ” Then [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant asked a string of questions as to the nature of the fight ; who had been hurt ; and how badly had [any body been hurt]2174-any body been hurt ; and what other harm had been done . The answers to all these questions were given with a fair amount of truth , except that the little circumstance of the origin of the fire was not explained . [Both Boscobel]53-boscobel and [Joe]79-joe had seen the torch put down , but it could hardly have been expected that [they]2175-they should have been explicit as to such a detail as that . Nor did [they]2175-they mention the names of either [[their]2175-they brother]2176-their brother [George]43-georgie or [Nokes]58-nokes . “[96-sergeant forrest] And who was there in the matter ? ” asked [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant . “[96-sergeant forrest] There was [young Heathcote]65-harry , and [a boy]1314-a boy [he]65-harry has got [there]290-there , and [the two chaps]1316-the two chaps as [he]65-harry calls [boundary rulers]1317-boundary rulers , and [Medlicot]47-medlicot , [the sugar fellow from [the mill]484-the mill]1318-the sugar fellow from the mill , and [a chap of [Medlicot]47-medlicot ’s [I]0-i never set eyes on before]1320-a chap of medlicot ’s i never set eyes on before . [They]1316-the two chaps must have expected something to be up , or [Heathcote]65-harry would not have been going about at night with [a tribe of men like that]1321-a tribe of men like that . ” “[1316-the two chaps] And who were [[your]0-i party]1322-your party ? ” “[1316-the two chaps] Well , there were just [ourselves]1323-ourselves , four of [us]1323-ourselves , for [Georgie]43-georgie was [here]260-here , and [this fellow Boscobel]1325-this fellow boscobel . [Georgie]43-georgie never stays long , and [he]43-georgie would n’t be welcome if [he]43-georgie did . [He]43-georgie turned up just by chance like , and now [he]43-georgie ’s off again . ” “[43-georgie] That was all , eh ? ” Of course [they]1323-ourselves all knew that [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant knew that [Nokes]58-nokes had been with [them]1323-ourselves . “[43-georgie] Well , then , that was n’t all , ” said [old Brownbie]43-georgie . “[58-nokes] [Bill Nokes]58-nokes was [here]260-here , whom [Heathcote]65-harry dismissed ever so long ago , and [that Chinese cook of [his]65-harry]1327-that chinese cook of his . [He]65-harry dismissed [him]58-nokes too , [I]0-i suppose . And [he]65-harry dismissed [Boscobel]53-boscobel here . ” “[65-harry] [No one]339-no one can live at [Gangoil]65-harry any time , ” said [Jack]78-jack . “[1260-every body] [Every body]1260-every body knows that . [He]65-harry wants to be [lord a’mighty over every thing]1330-lord a’mighty over every thing . But [he]65-harry ai n’t going to be lord a’mighty at [Boolabong]18-boolabong . ” “[65-harry] And [he]65-harry ai n’t going to burn [our]1331-our grass either , ” said [Joe]79-joe . “[65-harry] It ’s like [his]65-harry impudence coming on to [our]1331-our ran and burning every thing before [him]65-harry . [He]65-harry calls [hisself]1332-hisself [a magistrate]1796-a magistrate , but [he]65-harry ’s not to do just as [he]65-harry pleases because [he]65-harry ’s [a magistrate]1796-a magistrate . [I]0-i suppose [we]1331-our can swear against [him]65-harry for lighting [our]1331-our grass , [sergeant]1335-sergeant ? There is n’t one of [us]1331-our that did n’t see [him]65-harry do it . ” “[1331-our] And where is [Nokes]58-nokes ? ” asked [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant , paying no attention to the application made by [Mr. Brownbie]83-mr. brownbie , [junior]2180-junior , for redress to [himself]83-mr. brownbie . “[58-nokes] Well , ” said [Joe]79-joe , “[58-nokes] [Nokes]58-nokes is n’t any where about [Boolabong]18-boolabong . ” “[65-harry] [He]65-harry ’s away with [[your]0-i brother]1336-your brother [George]43-georgie ? ” “[65-harry] [I]0-i should n’t wonder , ” said [Joe]79-joe . “[0-i] It ’s a serious matter lighting a fire , [you]0-i know , ” said [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant . “[0-i] [A man]128-a man would have to swing for it . ” “[128-a man] Then why is n’t [young Heathcote]65-harry to swing ? ” demanded [Jack]78-jack . “[65-harry] There is such a thing as intent , [you]0-i know . When [Heathcote]65-harry lighted the fire , where would the fire have gone if [he]65-harry had n’t kept putting it out as fast as [he]65-harry kept lighting it ? On to [his]65-harry own run , not to [yours]0-i . And where would the other fire have gone which [somebody]1496-somebody lit , and which [nobody]1636-nobody put out , if [he]65-harry had n’t been there to stop it ? The less [you]0-i say against [Heathcote]65-harry the better . So [Nokes]58-nokes is off , is [he]65-harry ? ” “[65-harry] [He]65-harry ai n’t [here]260-here , anyways , ” said [Joe]79-joe . “[65-harry] When the row was over , [we]1341-we would n’t let [him]65-harry in . [We]1341-we did n’t want [him]65-harry about here . ” “[1341-we] [I]0-i dare say not , ” said [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant . “[1341-we] Now let [me]0-i go and see the spot where the fight was . ” So [the two policemen]2183-the two policemen , with [the two young Brownbies]2184-the two young brownbies , rode away , leaving [Boscobel]53-boscobel with [the old man]763-the old man . “[65-harry] [He]65-harry knows every thing about it , ” said [old Brownbie]79-joe . “[65-harry] If [he]65-harry do , ” said [Boscobel]53-boscobel , “[65-harry] it ai n’t no odds . ” “[65-harry] Not a ha’porth of odds , ” said [Jerry]77-jerry , coming out of [his]77-jerry hiding - place . “[65-harry] Who cares what [he]65-harry knows ? [A man]128-a man may do what [he]128-a man pleases on [his]128-a man own run , [I]0-i suppose . ” “[65-harry] [He]65-harry may n’t light a fire as ‘ ll spread , ” said [the old man]763-the old man . “[98-bother] [Bother]98-bother ! Who ’s to prove what ’s in [a man]128-a man ’s mind ? If [I]0-i ’d been [Nokes]58-nokes , [I]0-i ’d have staid and seen it out . [I]0-i ’d never be driven about [the colony]146-the colony by [such a fellow as [Heathcote]65-harry , with [all the police in [the world]1427-the world]1346-all the police in the world to back [him]65-harry]1345-such a fellow as heathcote , with all the police in the world to back him . ” [Sergeant Forrest]96-sergeant forrest inspected the ground on which the fire had raged , and the spot on which [the men]292-the men had met ; but nothing came of [his]96-sergeant forrest inspection , and [he]96-sergeant forrest had not expected that any thing would come of it . [He]96-sergeant forrest could see exactly where the fire had commenced , and could trace the efforts that had been made to stop it . [He]96-sergeant forrest did not in the least doubt the way in which it had been lit . But [he]96-sergeant forrest did very much doubt whether [a jury]2188-a jury could find [Nokes]58-nokes guilty , even if [he]2188-a jury could catch [Nokes]58-nokes . [Jacko]51-jacko ’s evidence was worth nothing , and [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot might be easily mistaken as to what [he]47-medlicot had seen at a distance in the middle of the night . All this happened on Christmas - day . At about nine o’clock the same evening [the two constables]2125-the two constables re - appeared at [Gangoil]65-harry , and asked for hospitality for the night . This was a matter of course , and also the reproduction of the Christmas dinner . [Mrs. Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot was now there , and [[her]48-mrs. medlicot son]2190-her son , with [his]2190-her son collar - bone set , had been allowed to come out on to [the veranda]174-the veranda . [The house]226-the house had already been supposed to be full , but room , as a matter of course , was made for [Sergeant Forrest]96-sergeant forrest and [[his]96-sergeant forrest man]820-his man . “[65-harry] It ’s a queer sort of Christmas [we]1348-we ’ve all been having , [Mr. Heathcote]57-mr. heathcote , ” said [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant , as the remnant of a real English plum - pudding was put between [him]96-sergeant forrest and [[his]96-sergeant forrest man]820-his man by [Mrs. Growler]45-mrs. growler . “[57-mr. heathcote] A little hotter than it is at [home]103-home , eh ? ” “[57-mr. heathcote] Indeed it is . [You]57-mr. heathcote must have had it hot last night , [Sir]1648-sir . ” “[1335-sergeant] Very hot , [sergeant]1335-sergeant . [We]1348-we had to work uncommonly hard to do it as well as [we]1348-we did . ” “[1348-we] It was not a nice Christmas game , [Sir]1648-sir , was it ? ” “[0-i] Eh , [me]0-i ! ” said [Mrs. Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot . “[0-i] There ’s nae Christmas games or ony games here at all , except just worrying and harrying , like sae many dogs at each other ’s throats . ” “[57-mr. heathcote] And [you]57-mr. heathcote think nothing more can be done ? ” [Harry]65-harry asked . “[57-mr. heathcote] [I]0-i do n’t think [we]1348-we shall catch [the men]292-the men . When [they]292-the men get out backward , it ’s very hard to trace [them]292-the men . [He]1354-he ’s got a horse of [his]1354-he own with [him]1354-he , and [he]1354-he ’ll be beyond reach of [the police]1255-the police by this time to - morrow . Indeed , [he]1354-he ’s beyond [their]1255-the police reach now . However , [you]57-mr. heathcote ’ll have got rid of [him]1354-he . ” “[57-mr. heathcote] But there are others as bad as [he]1354-he left behind . [I]0-i would n’t trust [that fellow Boscobel]1038-that fellow boscobel [a yard]1925-a yard . ” “[1354-he] [He]1354-he wo n’t stir , [Sir]1648-sir . [He]1354-he belongs to [this country]1599-this country , and does not want to leave [it]1599-this country . And when a thing has been tried like that and has failed , [the fellows]1360-the fellows do n’t try it again . [They]1360-the fellows are cowed like by [their]1360-the fellows own failure . [I]0-i do n’t think [you]57-mr. heathcote need fear fire from the [Boolabong]18-boolabong side again this summer . ” After this [the sergeant]2119-the sergeant and [[his]2119-the sergeant man]820-his man discreetly allowed [themselves]1360-the fellows to be put to bed in [the back cottage]2198-the back cottage ; for in truth , when [they]1360-the fellows arrived , things had come to such a pass at [Gangoil]65-harry that [the two additional visitors]2199-the two additional visitors were hardly welcome . But hospitality in [the bush]218-the bush can be stayed by no such considerations as that . Let [their]1360-the fellows employments or enjoyments on hand be what [they]1360-the fellows may , every thing must yield to the entertainment of [strangers]986-strangers . [The two constables]2125-the two constables were in want of [their]2125-the two constables Christmas dinner , and it was given to [them]2125-the two constables with no grudging hand . As to [Nokes]58-nokes , [we]2203-we may say that [he]58-nokes has never since appeared in [the neighborhood of [Gangoil]65-harry]2204-the neighborhood of gangoil , and that [none thereabouts]2205-none thereabouts ever knew what was [his]58-nokes fate . Men such as [he]58-nokes wander away from [one colony]2206-one colony into the next , passing from [one station]852-one station to another , or sleeping on the ground , till [they]1360-the fellows become as desolate and savage as solitary animals . And at last [they]1360-the fellows die in the bush , creeping , [we]2203-we may suppose , into hidden nooks , as the beasts do when the hour of death comes on [them]1360-the fellows . [The constables]2157-the constables had started from [Gangoil]65-harry , on [their]2157-the constables way to [Boolabong]18-boolabong , a little after four , and from that time till [he]58-nokes was made to get out of bed for [his]58-nokes dinner [Harry Heathcote]65-harry was allowed to sleep . [He]58-nokes had richly earned [his]58-nokes rest by [his]58-nokes work , and [he]58-nokes lay motionless , without a sound , in the broad daylight , with [his]58-nokes arm under [his]58-nokes head , dreaming , no doubt , of [some happy squatting land , in which there were no free - selectors]2209-some happy squatting land , in which there were no free - selectors , no fires , [no rebellious servants]2210-no rebellious servants , no floods , no droughts , no wild dogs to worry the lambs , no grass seeds to get into the fleeces , and in which the price of wool stood steady at two shillings and sixpence a pound . [[His]58-nokes wife]104-his wife from time to time came into [the room]199-the room , shading the light from [his]58-nokes eyes , protecting [him]58-nokes from the flies , and administering in [her]104-his wife soft way to what [she]104-his wife thought might be [his]58-nokes comforts . [His]58-nokes sleep was of the kind which no light , nor even flies , can interrupt . Once or twice [she]104-his wife stooped down and kissed [his]58-nokes brow , but [he]58-nokes was altogether unconscious of [her]104-his wife caress . During this time [old Mrs. Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot arrived ; but [her]48-mrs. medlicot coming did not awake [the sleeper]1774-the sleeper , though it was by no means made in silence . [The old woman]194-the old woman sobbed and cried over [[her]194-the old woman son]2190-her son , at the same time expressing [her]194-the old woman thankfulness that [he]58-nokes should have turned up in [the forest]361-the forest so exactly at the proper moment , evidently taking part in the conviction that [[her]194-the old woman [Giles]47-medlicot]2217-her giles had saved [Gangoil]65-harry and all its sheep . And then there were all the necessary arrangements to be made for the night , in accordance with which almost every body had to give up [his]2218-his or [her]2219-her bed and sleep somewhere else . But nothing disturbed [Harry]65-harry . For the present [he]65-harry was allowed to occupy [[his]65-harry own room]2220-his own room , and [he]65-harry enjoyed the privilege . [Kate Daly]41-kate during this time was much disturbed in mind . [The reader]117-the reader may remember — [Kate]41-kate , at any rate , remembered well — that , just as [the doctor]2065-the doctor had arrived to set [his]65-harry broken bone , [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot , disabled as [he]47-medlicot was , had attempted to take [her]41-kate by the arm . [He]47-medlicot had certainly chosen an odd time for a declaration of love , just the moment in which [he]47-medlicot ought to have been preparing [himself]47-medlicot for the manipulation of [his]47-medlicot fractured limb ; but , unless [he]47-medlicot had meant a declaration of love , surely [he]47-medlicot would not have seized [her]41-kate by the arm . It was a matter to [her]41-kate of great moment . Oh , of what vital importance ! [The English girl living in [a town]2224-a town , or even in what [we]2225-we call [the country]217-the country]2223-the english girl living in a town , or even in what we call the country , has no need to think of [any special man]2227-any special man till [some special man]2228-some special man thinks of [her]41-kate . [Men]130-men are fairly plentiful , and if [one man]759-one man does not come , another will . And there have probably been [men]130-men coming and going in some sort since [the girl]2232-the girl left [[her]2232-the girl school - room]2233-her school - room and became [a young lady]2234-a young lady . But in [the bush]218-the bush the thing is very different . It may be that there is [no young man]2236-no young man available within fifty miles — [no possible lover]2237-no possible lover or [future husband]2238-future husband , unless [Heaven]99-heaven should interfere almost with a miracle . To those to whom [lovers]2239-lovers are as plentiful as blackberries it may seem indelicate to surmise that the thought of such a want should ever enter [a girl]2108-a girl ’s head . [I]1362-him doubt whether the defined idea of any want had ever entered poor [Kate]41-kate ’s head . But now that [the possible lover]2241-the possible lover was there — not only possible , but very probable — and so eligible in many respects , living so close , with [a house]2242-a house over [his]2241-the possible lover head and a good business ; and then so handsome , and , as [Kate]41-kate thought , so complete [a gentleman]122-a gentleman ! Of course [she]41-kate turned it much in [her]41-kate mind . [She]41-kate was very happy with [Harry Heathcote]65-harry . There never was [a brother - in - law]1744-a brother - in - law so good ! But , after all , what is [a brother - in - law]1744-a brother - in - law , though [he]1744-a brother - in - law be the very best ? [Kate]41-kate had already begun to fancy that [a house of [her]41-kate own]2246-a house of her own and [a husband of [her]41-kate own]2247-a husband of her own would be essential to [her]41-kate happiness . But then [a man]128-a man can not be expected to make an offer with a broken collar - bone — certainly can not do so just when [the doctor]2065-the doctor has arrived to set the bone . Late on in the day , when [the doctor]2065-the doctor had gone , and [Medlicot]47-medlicot was , according to instructions , sitting out on [the veranda]174-the veranda in an armchair , and [[his]47-medlicot mother]488-his mother was with [him]47-medlicot , and while [Harry]65-harry was sleeping as though [he]65-harry never meant to be awake again , [Kate]41-kate managed to say a few words to [[her]41-kate sister]180-her sister . It will be understood that [the ladies]471-the ladies ’ hands were by no means empty . The Christmas dinner was in course of preparation , and [Sing Sing]54-sing sing , [that villainous Chinese cook]2255-that villainous chinese cook , had absconded . [Mrs. Growler]45-mrs. growler , no doubt , did [her]45-mrs. growler best ; but [Mrs. Growler]45-mrs. growler was old and slow , and [the house]226-the house was full of [guests]281-guests . It was by no means an idle time ; but still [Kate]41-kate found an opportunity to say a word to [[her]41-kate sister]180-her sister in [the kitchen]1456-the kitchen . “[1362-him] What do [you]1361-you think of [him]1362-him , [Mary]40-mary ? ” To [the married sister]2260-the married sister “[1361-you] [him]1362-him ” would naturally mean [Harry Heathcote]65-harry , of whom , as [he]1362-him lay asleep , [the young wife]2261-the young wife thought that [he]1362-him was the very perfection of patriarchal pastoral manliness ; but [she]2261-the young wife knew enough of human nature to be aware that the “[1362-him] [him]1362-him ” of the moment to [[her]2261-the young wife sister]180-her sister was no longer [[her]2261-the young wife own husband]2263-her own husband . “[0-i] [I]0-i think [he]1362-him has got [his]1362-him arm broken fighting for [Harry]65-harry , and that [we]1363-we are bound to do the best [we]1363-we can for [him]1362-him . ” “[1363-we] Oh yes ; that ’s of course . [I]0-i ’m sure [Harry]65-harry will feel that . [He]65-harry used , [you]1364-you know , to — to — that is , not just to like [him]65-harry , because [he]65-harry is [a free - selector]1432-a free - selector . ” “[65-harry] [They]1366-they ’ll drop all that now . Of course [they]1366-they could not be expected to know [each other]647-each other at the first starting . [I]0-i should n’t wonder if [they]1366-they became [regular friends]1368-regular friends . ” “[0-i] That would be nice ! After all , though [you]1364-you may be so happy at [home]103-home , it is better to have something like [a neighbor]687-a neighbor . Do n’t [you]1364-you think so ? ” “[1364-you] It depends on who [the neighbors]1371-the neighbors are . [I]0-i do n’t care much for [the Brownbies]65-harry . ” “[0-i] [They]1371-the neighbors are quite different , [Mary]40-mary . ” “[40-mary] [I]0-i like [the Medlicots]46-the medlicots very much . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i consider [he]65-harry ’s quite [a gentleman]122-a gentleman , ” said [Kate]41-kate . “[0-i] Of course [he]65-harry ’s [a gentleman]122-a gentleman . Look here , [Kate]41-kate — [I]0-i shall be ready to welcome [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot as [a brother - in - law]1744-a brother - in - law , if things should turn out that way . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i did n’t mean that , [Mary]40-mary . ” “[0-i] Did [you]0-i not ? Well , [you]0-i can mean it if [you]0-i please , as far as [I]0-i am concerned . Has [he]65-harry said any thing to [you]0-i , [dear]1452-dear ? ” “[65-harry] No . ” “[65-harry] Not a word ? ” “[65-harry] [I]0-i do n’t know what [you]0-i call a word ; not a word of that kind . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i thought , perhaps — ” “[0-i] [I]0-i think [he]65-harry meant it once — this morning . ” “[65-harry] [I]0-i dare say [he]65-harry meant it . And if [he]65-harry meant it this morning , [he]65-harry wo n’t have forgotten [his]65-harry meaning to - morrow . ” “[65-harry] There ’s no reason why [he]65-harry should mean it , [you]0-i know . ” “[65-harry] None in the least , [Kate]41-kate ; is there ? ” “[41-kate] Now [you]0-i ’re laughing at [me]0-i , [Mary]40-mary . [I]0-i never used to laugh at [you]0-i when [Harry]65-harry was coming . [I]0-i was so glad , and [I]0-i did every thing [I]0-i could . ” “[0-i] Yes , [you]0-i went away and left [us]1376-us in [the Botanical Gardens]1377-the botanical gardens . [I]0-i remember . But , [you]0-i see , there are [no Botanical Gardens]1378-no botanical gardens [here]260-here ; and [the poor man]1380-the poor man could n’t walk about if there were . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder what [Harry]65-harry would say if it were to be so . ” “[65-harry] Of course [he]65-harry ’d be glad — for [your]0-i sake . ” “[65-harry] But [he]65-harry does so despise free - selectors ! And then [he]65-harry used to think that [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot was quite as bad as [the Brownbies]65-harry . [I]0-i would n’t marry [any one]1493-any one to be despised by [you]0-i and [Harry]65-harry . ” “[65-harry] That ’s all gone by , [[my]0-i dear]1382-my dear , ” said [the wife]108-the wife , feeling that [she]108-the wife had to apologize for [[her]108-the wife husband]116-her husband ’s prejudices . “[65-harry] Of course [one]1423-one has to find out what [people]1472-people are before [one]1423-one takes [them]1472-people to [one]1423-one ’s bosom . [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot has acted in the most friendly way about these fires , and [I]0-i ’m sure [Harry]65-harry will never despise [him]47-medlicot any more . ” “[47-medlicot] [He]47-medlicot could n’t have done more for [a real brother]1387-a real brother than have [his]47-medlicot arm broken . ” “[47-medlicot] But [you]0-i must remember one thing , [Kate]41-kate , [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot is very nice , and like [a gentleman]122-a gentleman , and all that . Bat [you]0-i never can be quite certain about [any man]418-any man till [he]418-any man speaks out plainly . Do n’t set [your]0-i heart upon [him]418-any man till [you]0-i are quite sure that [he]418-any man has set [his]418-any man upon [you]0-i . ” “[418-any man] Oh no , ” said [Kate]41-kate , giving [her]41-kate maidenly assurance when it was so much too late ! Just at this moment [Mrs. Growler]45-mrs. growler came into [the kitchen]1456-the kitchen , and [Kate]41-kate ’s promises and [[her]41-kate sister]180-her sister ’s cautions were for the moment silenced . “[418-any man] How [we]1390-we ’re to manage to get the dinner on the table , [I]0-i for one do n’t know at all , ” said [Mrs. Growler]45-mrs. growler . “[0-i] There ’s [Mr. Bates’ll]100-mr. bates’ll be [here]260-here ; that will be six of ’em ; and that [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot will want [somebody]1496-somebody to do every thing for [him]47-medlicot , because [he]47-medlicot ’s been and got hisself smashed . And there ’s [the old lady]524-the old lady has just come out from [home]103-home , and is as particular as any thing . And [Mr. Harry]37-harry [himself]37-harry never thinks of things at all . One pair of hands , and them very old , ca n’t do every thing for every body . ” All of which was very well understood to mean nothing at all . Household deficiencies — and , indeed , all deficiencies — are considerable or insignificant in accordance with the aspirations of [those concerned]2268-those concerned . When [a man]128-a man has [a regiment of [servants]2271-servants]2270-a regiment of servants in [[his]128-a man dining - room]2272-his dining - room , with beautifully cut glass , a forest of flowers , and an iceberg in the middle of [his]128-a man table if the weather be hot , [[his]128-a man guests]2273-his guests will think [themselves]2273-his guests ill used and badly fed if aught in the banquet be astray . There must not be a rose leaf ruffled ; a failure in the attendance , a falling off in a dish , or a fault in the wine is a crime . But [the same guests]2274-the same guests shall be merry as the evening is long with a leg of mutton and whisky toddy , and will change [their]2274-the same guests own plates , and clear [their]2274-the same guests own table , and think nothing wrong , if from the beginning such has been the intention of [the giver of the feast]2275-the giver of the feast . In spite of [Mrs. Growler]45-mrs. growler ’s prognostications , though [the cook]1840-the cook had absconded , and [the chief guest of the occasion]2277-the chief guest of the occasion could not cut up [his]2277-the chief guest of the occasion own meat , that Christmas dinner at [Gangoil]65-harry was eaten with great satisfaction . [Harry]37-harry had been so far triumphant . [He]37-harry had stopped the fire that was intended to ruin [him]37-harry , [he]37-harry had beaten off [[his]37-harry enemies]152-his enemies on [their]152-his enemies own ground , and [he]37-harry was no longer oppressed by that sense of desolation which had almost overpowered [him]37-harry . “[1395-we] [We]1395-we ’ll give one toast , [Mrs. Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot , ” [he]57-mr. heathcote said , when [Mrs. Growler]45-mrs. growler and [Kate]41-kate between [them]1395-we had taken away the relics of the plum - pudding . “[48-mrs. medlicot] [[Our]1395-we friends]1396-our friends at [home]103-home ! ” [The poor lady]2279-the poor lady drank the toast with a sob . “[48-mrs. medlicot] That ’s vera weel for [you]1398-you , [Mr. Heathcote]57-mr. heathcote . [You]1398-you ’re young , and will win [your]1398-you way hame , and see [auld friends]1399-auld friends again , nae doubt ; but [I]0-i ’ll never see ane of [them]1399-auld friends mair , except those [I]0-i have [here]260-here . ” Nevertheless , [the old lady]524-the old lady ate [her]524-the old lady dinner and drank [her]524-the old lady toddy , and made much of the occasion , going in and out to [[her]524-the old lady son]2190-her son upon [the veranda]174-the veranda . Soon after dinner [Heathcote]57-mr. heathcote , as was [[his]57-mr. heathcote wo nt]2283-his wo nt , strayed out with [[his]57-mr. heathcote prime minister]2284-his prime minister [Bates]71-mr. bates to consult on the dangers which might be supposed still to threaten [[his]57-mr. heathcote kingdom]2285-his kingdom , and [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote , with [[her]42-mrs. heathcote youngest boy]2286-her youngest boy in [her]42-mrs. heathcote lap , sat talking to [Mrs. Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot in [the parlor]335-the parlor . Such was not [her]42-mrs. heathcote custom in weather such as this . [Kate]41-kate had been sent out on to [the veranda]174-the veranda , with special commands to attend to the wants of [the sufferer]2092-the sufferer , and [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote would have followed [her]41-kate had [she]42-mrs. heathcote not remembered [[her]42-mrs. heathcote sister]180-her sister ’s appeal , “[0-i] [I]0-i did every thing [I]0-i could for [you]0-i . ” In those happy days [Kate]41-kate had been very good , and certainly deserved requital for [her]41-kate services . And therefore , when [the men]292-the men had gone out , [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote , with [[her]42-mrs. heathcote guest]2292-her guest , remained in [the warm room]2293-the warm room , and went so far as to suggest that at that period of the day [the room]199-the room was preferable to [the veranda]174-the veranda . [Poor Mrs. Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot was new to the ways of [the bush]218-the bush , and fell into the trap ; thus [Kate Daly]41-kate was left alone with [[her]42-mrs. heathcote wounded hero]2297-her wounded hero . When told to take [him]2297-her wounded hero out [his]2297-her wounded hero glass of wine , and when conscious that [no one]339-no one followed [her]42-mrs. heathcote , [she]42-mrs. heathcote felt [herself]42-mrs. heathcote to have been guilty of some great sin , and was almost tempted to escape . [She]42-mrs. heathcote had asked [[her]42-mrs. heathcote sister]180-her sister for help ; and this was the help that was forth - coming — help so palpable , so manifest , as to be almost indelicate ! Would [he]2297-her wounded hero think that plans were being made to catch [him]2297-her wounded hero , now that [he]2297-her wounded hero was [a captive and impotent]2300-a captive and impotent ? The thought that it was possible that such an idea might occur to [him]2297-her wounded hero was terrible to [her]42-mrs. heathcote . [She]42-mrs. heathcote would rather lose [him]2297-her wounded hero altogether than feel the stain of such a suggestion on [her]42-mrs. heathcote own conscience . [She]42-mrs. heathcote put the glass of wine down on the little table by [his]2297-her wounded hero side , and then attempted to withdraw . “[0-i] Stay a moment with [me]0-i , ” [he]2297-her wounded hero said . “[0-i] Where are [they]1401-they all ? ” “[40-mary] [Mary]40-mary and [[your]1402-you mother]1102-your mother are inside . [Harry]37-harry and [Mr. Bates]71-mr. bates have gone across to look at the horses . ” “[71-mr. bates] [I]0-i almost feel as though [I]0-i could walk , too . ” “[71-mr. bates] [You]1402-you must not think of it yet , [Mr. Medlicot]47-medlicot . It seems almost a wonder that [you]1402-you should n’t have to be in bed , and [you]1402-you with [your]1402-you collar - bone broken only last night ! [I]0-i do n’t know how [you]1402-you can bear it as [you]1402-you do . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i shall be so glad [I]0-i broke it , if one thing will come about . ” “[0-i] What thing ? ” asked [Kate]41-kate , blushing . “[41-kate] [Kate]41-kate — may [I]0-i call [you]41-kate [Kate]41-kate ? ” “[41-kate] [I]0-i do n’t know , ” [she]41-kate said . “[0-i] [You]1402-you know [I]0-i love [you]1402-you , do [you]1402-you not ? [You]1402-you must know it . [Dearest Kate]101-dearest kate , can [you]41-kate love [me]0-i and be [[my]0-i wife]1631-my wife ? ” [His]1402-you left arm was bound up , and was in a sling , but [he]1402-you put out [his]1402-you right hand to take [hers]41-kate , if [she]41-kate would give it to [him]1402-you . [Kate Daly]41-kate had never had [a lover]1745-a lover before , and felt the occasion to be trying . [She]41-kate had no doubt about the matter . If it were only proper for [her]41-kate to declare [herself]41-kate , [she]41-kate could swear with a safe conscience that [she]41-kate loved [him]1402-you better than all [the world]1427-the world . “[101-dearest kate] Put [your]41-kate hand here , [Kate]41-kate , ” [he]1402-you said . As the request was not exactly for the gift of [her]41-kate hand , [she]41-kate placed it in [his]1402-you . “[41-kate] May [I]0-i keep it now ? ” [She]41-kate could only whisper something which was quite inaudible , even to [him]1402-you . “[0-i] [I]0-i shall keep it , and think that [you]1405-you are all [my]0-i own . Stoop down , [Kate]41-kate , and kiss [me]0-i , if [you]1405-you love [me]0-i . ” [She]41-kate hesitated for a moment , trying to collect [her]41-kate thoughts . [She]41-kate did love [him]1402-you , and was [his]1402-you own ; still , to stoop and kiss [a man who , if such a thing were to be allowed at all]2303-a man who , if such a thing were to be allowed at all , ought certainly to kiss [her]41-kate ! [She]41-kate did not think [she]41-kate could do that . But then [she]41-kate was bound to protect [him]1402-you , wounded and broken as [he]1402-you was , from [his]1402-you own imprudence ; and if [she]41-kate did not stoop to [him]1402-you , [he]1402-you would rise to [her]41-kate . [She]41-kate was still in doubt , still standing with [her]41-kate hand in [his]1402-you , half bending over [him]1402-you , but yet half resisting as [she]41-kate bent , when , all suddenly , [Harry Heathcote]65-harry was on [the veranda]174-the veranda , followed by [the two policemen]2183-the two policemen , who had just returned from [Boolabong]18-boolabong . [She]41-kate was sure that [Harry]65-harry had seen [her]41-kate , and was by no means sure that [she]41-kate had been quick enough in escaping from [[her]41-kate lover]2306-her lover ’s hand to have been unnoticed by [the policemen]2124-the policemen also . [She]41-kate fled away as though guilty , and could hardly recover [herself]41-kate sufficiently to assist [Mrs. Growler]45-mrs. growler in producing the additional dinner which was required . [The two men]2308-the two men were quickly sent to [their]2308-the two men rest , as has been told before ; and [Harry]65-harry , who had in truth seen how close to [[his]65-harry friend]498-his friend [[his]65-harry sister - in - law]183-his sister - in - law had been standing , would , had it been possible , have restored [the lovers]2311-the lovers to [their]2311-the lovers old positions ; but [they]2308-the two men were all now on [the veranda]174-the veranda , and it was impossible . [Kate]41-kate hung back , half in and half out of [the sitting - room]2313-the sitting - room , and [old Mrs. Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot had seated [herself]48-mrs. medlicot close to [[her]48-mrs. medlicot son]2190-her son . [Harry]65-harry was lying at full length on a rug , and [[his]65-harry wife]104-his wife was sitting over [him]65-harry . Then [Giles Medlicot]47-medlicot , who was not quite contented with the present condition of affairs , made a little speech . “[42-mrs. heathcote] [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote , ” [he]0-i said , “[42-mrs. heathcote] [I]0-i have asked [[your]42-mrs. heathcote sister]1109-your sister to marry [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] Dearie [me]0-i , [Giles]47-medlicot , ” said [Mrs. Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot . [Kate]41-kate remained no longer half in and half out of [the parlor]335-the parlor , but retreated altogether and hid [herself]41-kate . [Harry]65-harry turned [himself]65-harry over on the rug , and looked up at [[his]65-harry wife]104-his wife , claiming infinite credit in that [he]65-harry had foreseen that such a thing might happen . “[47-medlicot] And what answer has [she]1109-your sister given [you]42-mrs. heathcote ? ” said [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote . “[1109-your sister] [She]1109-your sister has n’t given [me]0-i any answer yet . [I]0-i wonder what [you]42-mrs. heathcote and [Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote would say about it ? ” “[42-mrs. heathcote] What [Kate]41-kate has to say is much more important , ” replied [the discreet sister]2318-the discreet sister . “[41-kate] [I]0-i should like it of all things , ” said [Harry]65-harry , jumping up . “[0-i] It ’s always best to be open about these things . When [you]42-mrs. heathcote first came [here]260-here , [I]0-i did n’t like [you]42-mrs. heathcote . [You]42-mrs. heathcote took a bit of [my]0-i river frontage — not that it does [me]0-i any great harm — and then [I]0-i was angry about [that scoundrel Nokes]1408-that scoundrel nokes . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i was wrong about [Nokes]58-nokes , ” said [Medlicot]47-medlicot , “[58-nokes] and have , therefore , had [my]0-i collar - bone broken . As to [the land]499-the land , [you]42-mrs. heathcote ’ll forgive [my]0-i having it if [Kate]41-kate will come and live [there]290-there ? ” “[41-kate] By [George]43-georgie ! [I]0-i should think so.—Kate , why do n’t [you]42-mrs. heathcote come out ? Come along , [[my]0-i girl]1411-my girl . [Medlicot]47-medlicot has spoken out openly , and [you]42-mrs. heathcote should answer [him]47-medlicot in the same fashion . ” So saying , [he]47-medlicot dragged [her]41-kate forth , and [I]47-medlicot fear that , as far as [she]41-kate was concerned , something of the sweetness of [her]41-kate courtship was lost by the publicity with which [she]41-kate was forced to confess [her]41-kate love . “[47-medlicot] Will [you]42-mrs. heathcote go , [Kate]41-kate , and make sugar down at [the mill]484-the mill ? [I]0-i have often thought how bad it would be for [Mary]40-mary and [me]0-i when [you]42-mrs. heathcote were taken away ; but [we]1413-we sha’n’t mind it so much if [we]1413-we knew that [you]42-mrs. heathcote are to be near [us]1413-we . ” “[41-kate] Speak to [him]47-medlicot , [Kate]41-kate , ” said [Mrs. Heathcote]42-mrs. heathcote , with [her]42-mrs. heathcote arm round [[her]42-mrs. heathcote sister]180-her sister ’s waist . “[41-kate] [I]0-i think [she]41-kate ’s minded to have [him]47-medlicot , ” said [Mrs. Medlicot]48-mrs. medlicot . “[41-kate] Tell [me]0-i , [Kate]41-kate — shall it be so ? ” pleaded [the lover]2320-the lover . [She]41-kate came up to [him]47-medlicot and leaned over [him]47-medlicot , and whispered one word which [nobody else]2321-nobody else heard . But [they]2322-they all knew what the word was . And before [they]2322-they separated for the night [she]41-kate was left alone with [him]47-medlicot , and [he]47-medlicot got the kiss for which [he]47-medlicot was asking when [the policemen]2124-the policemen interrupted [them]2322-they . “[41-kate] That ’s what [I]0-i call a happy Christmas , ” said [Harry]65-harry , as [the party]1967-the party finally parted for the night .
